ffaframework coverage - 100.00%

#' Plot Return Levels and Confidence Intervals
2 
#'
3 
#' Constructs a time–series plot of estimated return levels along with their
4 
#' associated confidence intervals. The confidence bounds are shown as a shaded ribbon,
5 
#' and the point estimates are overlaid as a solid line. The return periods are
6 
#' displayed on a logarithmic scale.
7 
#'
8 
#' If the specified model is non-stationary, the `slice` argument is required
9 
#' and the return levels are reported as "Effective Return Periods".
10 
#'
11 
#' @param results A list of estimated return levels and confidence intervals
12 
#' generated by \link{uncertainty_bootstrap} or \link{uncertainty_rfpl}.
13 
#'
14 
#' @param ... Optional named arguments: 'title', 'xlabel', and 'ylabel'.
15 
#'
16 
#' @return `ggplot`; a plot showing:
17 
#' - A dashed black line for both the lower and upper confidence bounds.
18 
#' - A semi-transparent gray ribbon between `results$ci_lower` and `results$ci_upper`.
19 
#' - A solid blue line for the point estimates.
20 
#'
21 
#' @examples
22 
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)
23 
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)
24 
#' results <- uncertainty_bootstrap(data, "WEI", "L-moments")
25 
#' plot_uncertainty(results)
26 
#'
27 
#' @import ggplot2
28 
#' @export
29 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
plot_uncertainty <- function(results, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a dataframe for the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    3x
                    
                      
	df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    3x
                    
                      
		t = results$t,

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    3x
                    
                      
		ci_lower = results$ci_lower,

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    3x
                    
                      
		ci_upper = results$ci_upper,

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    3x
                    
                      
		estimates = results$estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	# Capture optional arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    3x
                    
                      
	args <- list(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	# Define labels for the plot 

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    3x
                    
                      
	title <- "FFA Estimates and Uncertainty"

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    3x
                    
                      
	xlabel <- if (results$trend$location || results$trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1x
                    
                      
		sprintf("Effective Return Period in %s", results$slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	} else { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
		"Return Period (Years)" 

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    3x
                    
                      
	ylabel <- expression("AMS (" * m^3/s * ")")

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
    # Override defaults if provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$title))  title  <- args$title

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$xlabel)) xlabel <- args$xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$ylabel)) ylabel <- args$ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Define properties for the legend

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    3x
                    
                      
	labels <- c("Confidence Bounds", "Estimates")

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    3x
                    
                      
	styles <- c("dashed", "solid")

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the plot, adding the theme without plot-theme.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    3x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(data = df, aes(x = t)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    3x
                    
                      
			aes(y = .data$ci_lower, linetype = "1"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    3x
                    
                      
			color = "black",

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    3x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    3x
                    
                      
			aes(y = .data$ci_upper, linetype = "1"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    3x
                    
                      
			color = "black",

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    3x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_ribbon(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    3x
                    
                      
			aes(ymin = .data$ci_lower, ymax = .data$ci_upper),

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    3x
                    
                      
			fill = "gray",

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    3x
                    
                      
			alpha = 0.4

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    3x
                    
                      
			aes(y = .data$estimates, linetype = "2"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    3x
                    
                      
			color = "blue",

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    3x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    3x
                    
                      
		scale_linetype_manual(labels = labels, values = styles) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    3x
                    
                      
		labs(title = title, x = xlabel, y = ylabel, linetype = "Legend") + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    3x
                    
                      
		scale_x_log10(breaks = df$t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
	# Add the theme and return 

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    3x
                    
                      
	add_theme(p1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Spearman Test for Autocorrelation

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the Spearman rank autocorrelation test on annual maximum streamflow 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' (AMS) data to check for autocorrelation at various lags. Reports the smallest 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' lag where the autocorrelation is not statistically significant at the given 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' significance level.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `rho`: Numeric vector of autocorrelation estimates for lags \eqn{1} to \eqn{n-3}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `sig`: Logical vector indicating which lags exhibit significant autocorrelation.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `least.lag`: The smallest lag at which the autocorrelation is insignificant. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If `TRUE`, then `least.lag > 0`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' For each lag from \eqn{1} to \eqn{n - 3}, the function computes the Spearman 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' correlation coefficient between the AMS series and its lagged version. The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' first lag with an insignificant autocorrelation coefficient returned as `least.lag`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link[stats]{cor.test}, \link{eda_bbmk_test}, \link{plot_spearman_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_spearman_test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats cor.test

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
eda_spearman_test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    11x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    11x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    11x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Assign a variable to the number of data points for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    11x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the spearman rho-autocorrelation for a given lag

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    11x
                    
                      
	rho_autocorrelation <- function(lag, data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    1029x
                    
                      
		data_original <- data[(lag + 1):length(data)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1029x
                    
                      
		data_lagged <- data[1:(length(data) - lag)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1029x
                    
                      
		cor.test(data_original, data_lagged, method="spearman", exact=FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Find the lowest non-significant serial correlation lag

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    11x
                    
                      
	rho <- numeric(n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    11x
                    
                      
	p_values <- numeric(n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    11x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(n - 3)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1029x
                    
                      
		result <- rho_autocorrelation(i, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1029x
                    
                      
		rho[i] = result$estimate

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1029x
                    
                      
		p_values[i] = result$p.value

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    11x
                    
                      
	least_lag <- which(p_values > alpha)[1] - 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Get a series of booleans for whether the serial correlation is significant

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    11x
                    
                      
	sig <- (p_values <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    11x
                    
                      
	reject <- (least_lag > 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    11x
                    
                      
	result <- ifelse(reject, "evidence", "NO evidence")

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    11x
                    
                      
	l1 <- sprintf("The Spearman test found a least insignificant lag of %f.", least_lag)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    11x
                    
                      
	l2 <- sprintf("There is %s of serial correlation.", result)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    11x
                    
                      
	msg <- paste0("\n - ", c(l1, l2), collapse = "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    11x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    11x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    11x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    11x
                    
                      
		rho = rho,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    11x
                    
                      
		sig = sig,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    11x
                    
                      
		least_lag = least_lag,

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    11x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    11x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' L-Moments Parameter Estimation for the Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This functions estimates the parameters of the four-parameter Kappa distribution 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' using the method of L-moments. Since there is no known closed form solution for 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' the parameters in terms of the L-moments, the parameters are computed numerically 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' using Newton-Raphson iteration.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' First, the sample L-moments of the data are computed using the \link{lmom_sample}

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' method. Then, the \link[stats]{optim} function is used to determine the

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' parameters by minimizing the `sumquad.tau3tau4` helper function. The implementation of

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' this routine is based on the deprecated `homtest` package.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of four parameters in the order location, scale, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   shape (1), shape (2).

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J.R.M. & Wallis, J.R., 1997. Regional frequency analysis: an approach based 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' on L-Moments. Cambridge University Press, New York, USA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{lmom_sample}, \link{fit_lmom_fast}, \link{fit_lmom_methods}

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' fit_lmom_kappa(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_kappa <- function(data, override = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    15x
                    
                      
	validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    15x
                    
                      
	moments <- lmom_sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    15x
                    
                      
	l1 <- moments[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    15x
                    
                      
	l2 <- moments[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    15x
                    
                      
	t3 <- moments[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    15x
                    
                      
	t4 <- moments[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    15x
                    
                      
    result <- optim(c(1, 1), sumquad.tau3tau4, t3.t4 = c(t3, t4))

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    15x
                    
                      
    if (result$value != -1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    15x
                    
                      
        k <- result$par[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    15x
                    
                      
        h <- result$par[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    15x
                    
                      
        params <- mu.sigma(l1, l2, k, h)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    15x
                    
                      
        mu <- params$mu

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    15x
                    
                      
        sigma <- params$sigma

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    15x
                    
                      
	c(mu, sigma, k, h)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute L-moment Distance for Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
sumquad.tau3tau4 = function (k.h, t3.t4) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1090x
                    
                      
	k <- k.h[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1090x
                    
                      
	h <- k.h[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1090x
                    
                      
	t3 <- t3.t4[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1090x
                    
                      
	t4 <- t3.t4[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1090x
                    
                      
	if (((k < -1) && (h >= 0)) || ((h < 0) && ((k <= -1) || (k >= -1/h)))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    3x
                    
                      
		stop("invalid parameters")

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    1087x
                    
                      
	g <- c(0,0,0,0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# GUM Case

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    1087x
                    
                      
	if (k == 0 && h == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    1x
                    
                      
		tau3 <- log(9 / 8) / log(2)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    1x
                    
                      
		tau4 <- (16 * log(2) - 10 * log(3)) / log(2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	# GEV Case

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    1087x
                    
                      
	else if (h == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    1x
                    
                      
		tau3 <- 2*(1 - 3^(-k))/(1 - 2^(-k)) - 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    1x
                    
                      
		tau4 <- (5*(1 - 4^(-k)) - 10*(1 - 3^(-k)) + 6*(1 - 2^(-k)))/(1 - 2^(-k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	# General Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
	else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1085x
                    
                      
		for (r in 1:4) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    4340x
                    
                      
			if (h > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    3540x
                    
                      
				g[r] <- (r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(r/h)) / (h^(1+k) *gamma(1+k+r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
			else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    800x
                    
                      
				g[r] <- (r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(-k-r/h)) / ((-h)^(1+k) *gamma(1-r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1085x
                    
                      
		tau3 <- (-g[1] + 3*g[2] -2*g[3])/(g[1]-g[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1085x
                    
                      
		tau4 <- -(-g[1] + 6*g[2] -10*g[3] + 5*g[4])/(g[1]-g[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    1087x
                    
                      
	(t3-tau3)^2 + (t4-tau4)^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute Location and Scale of Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
mu.sigma = function (l1, l2, k, h) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    20x
                    
                      
	if (((k < -1) && (h >= 0)) || ((h < 0) && ((k <= -1) || (k >= -1/h)))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    3x
                    
                      
		stop("invalid parameters")

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    17x
                    
                      
	g <- c(0,0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
	# GUM Case

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    17x
                    
                      
	if (k == 0 && h == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    1x
                    
                      
		sigma <- l2 / log(2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    1x
                    
                      
		mu <- l1 + digamma(1) * sigma

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
	# GEV Case

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    17x
                    
                      
	else if (h == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    1x
                    
                      
		sigma <- (l2 * k) / ((1 - 2^(-k)) * gamma(1 + k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    1x
                    
                      
		mu <- l1 - sigma * (1 - gamma(1 + k)) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
	# General Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
	else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    15x
                    
                      
		for (r in 1:2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    30x
                    
                      
			if (h > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    22x
                    
                      
				g[r] <- (r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(r/h)) / (h^(1+k) *gamma(1+k+r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
			else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    8x
                    
                      
				g[r] <- (r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(-k-r/h)) / ((-h)^(1+k) *gamma(1-r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    15x
                    
                      
		sigma <- (l2 * k) / (g[1] - g[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    15x
                    
                      
		mu <- l1 - sigma*(1 - g[1]) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    17x
                    
                      
	list(mu = mu, sigma = sigma)

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Regula-Falsi Confidence Intervals for Flood Quantile Estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculates estimates and confidence intervals for return levels at standard 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' return periods (2, 5, 10, 20, 50, and 100 years) using the profile likelihood 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' and Regula-Falsi root‐finding method.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-model

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param eps Numeric scalar. The log-likelihood tolerance for the Regula-Falsi 

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' convergence (default is 0.01).

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list contianing the return levels and confidence intervals containing: 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `estimates`: Estimated quantiles for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_lower`: Lower bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_upper`: Upper bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t`: Vector of return periods `c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)` in years.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `slice`: The value of `slice` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' - `trend`: The value of `trend` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. Fits the model using \link{fit_maximum_likelihood} to obtain parameter 

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'    estimates and log‐likelihood.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. Defines an objective function \eqn{f(y_p, p)} based on the chi-squared 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'    distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. Iteratively brackets the root by scaling initial guesses by 0.05 until 

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'    \eqn{f(y_p, p)} changes sign.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. Uses the Regula Falsi method to solve \eqn{f(y_p, p) = 0} for each 

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'    return-period probability.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' 5. Returns lower and upper confidence bounds at significance level `alpha` 

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'    given the return level estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @note Although the more modern \link[stats]{optim} function is preferred over 

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' \link[stats]{nlminb}, we use \link[stats]{nlminb} because it supports non-finite

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' values of the likelihood function. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{quantile_fast}, \link{uncertainty_bootstrap}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link{plot_uncertainty}

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' uncertainty_rfpl(data, "GLO")

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats qchisq nlminb

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
uncertainty_rfpl <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
    data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
    model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
    prior = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
    years = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
    trend = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
    slice = 1900,

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
    alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
    eps = 1e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    24x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    24x
                    
                      
	model <- validate_model(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    24x
                    
                      
	prior <- validate_prior(prior)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    24x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    24x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    24x
                    
                      
	slice <- validate_slice(slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    24x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for computing the profile likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    24x
                    
                      
	profile_likelihood <- function(yp, p, initial, prior = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
		# Remove the parameter we are using for reparameterization on yp

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    6667x
                    
                      
		if (model != "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    5880x
                    
                      
			initial <- initial[-1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6667x
                    
                      
		} else if (model == "WEI" && !trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    244x
                    
                      
			initial <- initial[-2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    543x
                    
                      
			initial <- initial[-3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
		# Set the default bounds based on the trend and model

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    6667x
                    
                      
		if (trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    3926x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    3926x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    2741x
                    
                      
			lower <- numeric(0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    2741x
                    
                      
			upper <- numeric(0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    6667x
                    
                      
		if (trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1877x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(lower, 1e-8, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1877x
                    
                      
			upper <- c(upper,  Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    4790x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(lower, 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    4790x
                    
                      
			upper <- c(upper,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
		# The Weibull distribution has different parameter bounds

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    6667x
                    
                      
		if (model == "WEI") { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    787x
                    
                      
			if (trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    543x
                    
                      
				lower <- c(-Inf, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    543x
                    
                      
				upper <- c( Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
			} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    244x
                    
                      
				lower <- c(-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    244x
                    
                      
				upper <- c( Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    787x
                    
                      
			if (trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    254x
                    
                      
				lower <- c(lower, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    254x
                    
                      
				upper <- c(upper,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
		# Add bounds for the shape parameter if necessary

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    6667x
                    
                      
		info <- model_info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    6667x
                    
                      
		if (info$n_params == 3) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
			# Set finite bounds on the shape parameter for RFGPL

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    4622x
                    
                      
			if (is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    3247x
                    
                      
				lower <- c(lower, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    3247x
                    
                      
				upper <- c(upper,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
			} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    1375x
                    
                      
				lower <- c(lower, -0.5 + 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    1375x
                    
                      
				upper <- c(upper,  0.5 - 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
		# Maximize the log-likelihood by minimizing the negative log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    6667x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(theta) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
			# Reparameterize on the location for non-Weibull distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    808386x
                    
                      
			if (model != "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
				# Get the quantile at probability p with location 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    682885x
                    
                      
				qp <- quantile_fast(p, model, c(0, theta), slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
				# Log-transform yp, qp if necessary

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    680657x
                    
                      
				if (model %in% c("LNO", "LP3")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    13769x
                    
                      
					yp <- log(yp)

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    13769x
