					qp <- log(qp)

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
				}

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
				# Reparameterize in terms of the quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    680657x
                    
                      
				theta <- c(yp - qp, theta)

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
			} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
			# Use a different reparameterization for the Weibull distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
			else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
				# i and j are used to shift location in the parameter vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    125501x
                    
                      
				i <- trend$location

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    125501x
                    
                      
				j <- trend$scale

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
				# Get the quantiles for the Wei(0, 1, shape) distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    125501x
                    
                      
				qp <- quantile_wei(p, c(0, 1, theta[2 + i + j]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      
				# Reparameterize on the scale parameter sigma

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    125501x
                    
                      
				covariate <- get_covariates(slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    125501x
                    
                      
				if (trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    112627x
                    
                      
					sigma <- (yp - theta[1] - (theta[2] * covariate)) / qp

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
				} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    12874x
                    
                      
					sigma <- (yp - theta[1]) / qp

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
				}

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    125501x
                    
                      
				if (trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    70843x
                    
                      
					sigma <- sigma - (theta[2 + i] * covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      
				}

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      
				# Reassemble the parameter vector 

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    125501x
                    
                      
				theta <- c(theta[1:(1 + i)], sigma, theta[(2 + i):(2 + i + j)])

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    
                    
                      
			# Use the correct likelihood function based on whether there is a prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    806158x
                    
                      
			if (!is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    208173x
                    
                      
				0 - general_loglik_fast(data, model, theta, prior, years, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      
			} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    597985x
                    
                      
				0 - loglik_fast(data, model, theta, years, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      
		# Helper function for running parameter optimization

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    6667x
                    
                      
		optimizer <- function(theta) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    8895x
                    
                      
			nlminb(theta, objective, lower = lower, upper = upper)

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    
                    
                      
		# Repeatedly attempt optimization using the optim() function

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    6667x
                    
                      
		attempts <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    6667x
                    
                      
		params <- initial

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    6667x
                    
                      
		while (attempts <= 100) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    
                    
                      
			

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      
			# Attempt to run the optimize() function

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    8895x
                    
                      
			result <- tryCatch(optimizer(params), error = function(e) NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    
                    
                      
			# If optimization succeeded, end the loop

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    8895x
                    
                      
			if (!is.null(result)) break

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      
			# If optimization failed, perturb the parameters and try again

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    2228x
                    
                      
			perturbation <- rnorm(n = length(params), mean = 0, sd = 0.2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    2228x
                    
                      
			params <- initial * (1 + perturbation)

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    2228x
                    
                      
			attempts <- attempts + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    
                    
                      
		# Flip the sign because we optimized the negative log-likelihood earlier

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    6667x
                    
                      
		0 - result$objective

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    
                    
                      
	# Define the non-exceedance probabilities for the target return periods

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    24x
                    
                      
	t <- c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    24x
                    
                      
	returns <- 1 - (1 / t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the results of maximum likelihood estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    24x
                    
                      
	mle <- fit_maximum_likelihood(data, model, prior, years, trend) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    24x
                    
                      
	lp_hat <- mle$mll

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    24x
                    
                      
	yp_hat <- quantile_fast(returns, model, mle$params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    
                    
                      
	# We want to find the roots of the function f defined below:

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    24x
                    
                      
	f <- function(yp, p) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    6667x
                    
                      
		lp_theta <- profile_likelihood(yp, p, mle$params, prior)

                    		
                  

                  

                    229
                    6667x
                    
                      
		lp_theta - (lp_hat - (qchisq(1 - alpha, 1) / 2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    
                    
                      
	# Define a helper function for regula-falsi iteration

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    24x
                    
                      
	regula.falsi <- function(a, b, p) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute c from a and b

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    996x
                    
                      
		c <- ((a * f(b, p)) - (b * f(a, p))) / (f(b, p) - f(a, p))

                    		
                  

                  

                    237
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    238
                    
                    
                      
		# If f(c) is small, we are done

                    		
                  

                  

                    239
                    996x
                    
                      
		if (abs(f(c, p)) < eps) return (c) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    240
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    241
                    
                    
                      
		# Otherwise, update a, b and then call regula.falsi again

                    		
                  

                  

                    242
                    562x
                    
                      
		if (f(c, p) < 0) { a <- c } else { b <- c }

                    		
                  

                  

                    243
                    708x
                    
                      
		regula.falsi(a, b, p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    244
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    245
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    246
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    247
                    
                    
                      
	# Run uncertainty quantification

                    		
                  

                  

                    248
                    24x
                    
                      
	ci_lower <- numeric(length(yp_hat))

                    		
                  

                  

                    249
                    24x
                    
                      
	ci_upper <- numeric(length(yp_hat))

                    		
                  

                  

                    250
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    251
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through the return periods 

                    		
                  

                  

                    252
                    24x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:length(yp_hat)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    253
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    254
                    
                    
                      
		# Find initial lower bound for mu

                    		
                  

                  

                    255
                    144x
                    
                      
		yp_minus <- yp_hat[i] * 0.95

                    		
                  

                  

                    256
                    144x
                    
                      
		while (f(yp_minus, returns[i]) > 0) yp_minus <- yp_minus * 0.95

                    		
                  

                  

                    257
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    258
                    
                    
                      
		# Run the iteration algorithm to find the lower confidence interval

                    		
                  

                  

                    259
                    144x
                    
                      
		yp_lower <- regula.falsi(yp_minus, yp_hat[i], returns[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    260
                    144x
                    
                      
		ci_lower[i] <- yp_lower

                    		
                  

                  

                    261
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    262
                    
                    
                      
		# Find initial upper bound for mu

                    		
                  

                  

                    263
                    144x
                    
                      
		yp_plus <- yp_hat[i] * 1.05

                    		
                  

                  

                    264
                    144x
                    
                      
		while (f(yp_plus, returns[i]) > 0) yp_plus <- yp_plus * 1.05

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    
                    
                      
		# Run the iteration algorithm to find the upper confidence interval

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    144x
                    
                      
		yp_upper <- regula.falsi(yp_hat[i], yp_plus, returns[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    144x
                    
                      
		ci_upper[i] <- yp_upper

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    24x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    24x
                    
                      
		t = t,

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    24x
                    
                      
		ci_lower = ci_lower,

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    24x
                    
                      
		estimates = yp_hat ,

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    24x
                    
                      
		ci_upper = ci_upper,

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    24x
                    
                      
		slice = slice,

                    		
                  

                  

                    278
                    24x
                    
                      
		trend = trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    279
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    280
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Sample Bootstrap Confidence Intervals for Flood Quantile Estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes estimates and confidence intervals for return levels at return periods

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, and 100 years using the sample bootstrap method. This function 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' supports a variety of probability models and parameter estimation methods.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-model

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-method

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-samples

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list contianing the return levels and confidence intervals containing: 

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `estimates`: Estimated quantiles for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_lower`: Lower bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_upper`: Upper bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t`: Vector of return periods; `c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `slice`: The value of `slice` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `trend`: The value of `trend` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' The bootstrap procedure samples from the fitted distribution via inverse 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' transform sampling. For each bootstrapped sample, the parameters are re-estimated 

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' using the specified `method`. Then, the bootstrapped parameters are used to compute 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' a new set of bootstrapped quantiles. Confidence intervals are obtained from the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' empirical non-exceedance probabilities of the bootstrapped quantiles.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{fit_lmom_fast}, \link{fit_maximum_likelihood}, \link{lmom_sample},

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link{quantile_fast}, \link{plot_uncertainty}

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' uncertainty_bootstrap(data, "WEI", "L-moments")

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats runif

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
uncertainty_bootstrap <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
    data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
    model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
    method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
    prior = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
    years = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
    trend = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
    slice = 1900,

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
    alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
    samples = 10000L

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    32x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    32x
                    
                      
	model <- validate_model(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    32x
                    
                      
	method <- validate_method(method)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    32x
                    
                      
	prior <- validate_prior(prior)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    32x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    32x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    32x
                    
                      
	slice <- validate_slice(slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    32x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    32x
                    
                      
	samples <- validate_samples(samples)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Set return periods and their quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    32x
                    
                      
	t = c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    32x
                    
                      
    returns <- 1 - (1 / t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    32x
                    
                      
    n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Define the parameter estimation function

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    32x
                    
                      
	fit <- function(data, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    198032x
                    
                      
		if (method == "L-moments") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    180018x
                    
                      
			return (fit_lmom_fast(data, model))

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    18014x
                    
                      
			return (fit_maximum_likelihood(data, model, prior, years, trend)$params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimated quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    32x
                    
                      
	params <- fit(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    32x
                    
                      
	estimates <- quantile_fast(returns, model, params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the bootstrapped quantiles 

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    32x
                    
                      
	quantiles <- sapply(1:n, function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    3193x
                    
                      
		u <- runif(samples)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    3193x
                    
                      
		quantile_fast(u, model, params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
	# Some distributions generate negative values. Adjust these to epsilon.

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    32x
                    
                      
	quantiles[quantiles < 0] = 1e-8

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
	# Vectorized bootstrap function 

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    32x
                    
                      
	bootstrap <- sapply(1:samples, function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    198000x
                    
                      
		bootstrap_params <- fit(quantiles[i, ], years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    198000x
                    
                      
		quantile_fast(returns, model, bootstrap_params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute confidence intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    32x
                    
                      
	probs <- c(alpha / 2, 1 - (alpha / 2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    32x
                    
                      
	ci <- apply(bootstrap, 1, quantile, probs = probs)

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    32x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    32x
                    
                      
		t = t,

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    32x
                    
                      
		ci_lower = ci[1, ],

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    32x
                    
                      
		estimates = estimates,

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    32x
                    
                      
		ci_upper = ci[2, ],

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    32x
                    
                      
		slice = slice,

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    32x
                    
                      
		trend = trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' L-Kurtosis Method for Distribution Selection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Selects a probability distribution by minimizing the absolute distance

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' between the theoretical L-kurtosis (\eqn{\tau_4}) and the sample L-kurtosis 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' (\eqn{t_4}). For 3-parameter distributions, we use the shape parameter that 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' best replicates the sample L-skewness (\eqn{t_3}) of the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with the results of distribution selection:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - `method`: `"L-kurtosis"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `metrics`: A list of L-kurtosis metrics for each distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `recommendation`: Name of the distribution with the smallest L-kurtosis metric

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' This method computes the distance between the sample and theoretical L-kurtosis 

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' values at a fixed L-skewness. For three parameter distributions, the shape parameter 

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' that best replicates the sample L-skewness is derived using \link[stats]{optim}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{lmom_sample}, \link{select_ldistance}, \link{select_zstatistic}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link{plot_lmom_diagram}

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' select_lkurtosis(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats optim

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
select_lkurtosis <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    6x
                    
                      
	validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the sample L-moments for data and log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    6x
                    
                      
	reg_t3_t4 <- lmom_sample(data)[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    6x
                    
                      
	log_t3_t4 <- lmom_sample(log(data))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize list of metrics

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    6x
                    
                      
	metrics <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through the list of distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GUM", "NOR", "LNO", "GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
		# Get distribution information

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    54x
                    
                      
		info <- model_info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
		# Determine the sample L-moments (regular or log)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    54x
                    
                      
		t3_t4 <- if (info$log) log_t3_t4 else reg_t3_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the L-kurtosis metric directly for two-parameter distributions 

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    54x
                    
                      
		if (info$n_params == 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    18x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmom_fast(model, c(0, 1))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    18x
                    
                      
			metrics[[model]] <- abs(tau3_tau4[2] - t3_t4[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    18x
                    
                      
			next

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
		# Find the shape parameter with the same L-skewness as the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    36x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1099x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmom_fast(model, c(0, 1, i))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1099x
                    
                      
			abs(tau3_tau4[1] - t3_t4[1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
		# Run optimization for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    36x
                    
                      
		result <- optim(

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    36x
                    
                      
			par = (info$k_bounds[1] + info$k_bounds[2]) / 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    36x
                    
                      
			fn = objective,

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    36x
                    
                      
			method = "Brent",

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    36x
                    
                      
			lower = info$k_bounds[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    36x
                    
                      
			upper = info$k_bounds[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the parameters of the fitted distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    36x
                    
                      
		tau3_tau4 <- lmom_fast(model, c(0, 1, result$par))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    36x
                    
                      
		metrics[[model]] <- abs(tau3_tau4[2] - t3_t4[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the recommendation (distribution with lowest L-distance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    6x
                    
                      
	recommendation <- names(metrics)[which.min(metrics)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
		method = "L-kurtosis",

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    6x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    6x
                    
                      
		metrics = metrics, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
		recommendation = recommendation

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Log-Likelihood Helper Function

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A helper function used by \link{loglik_methods}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' This function does not validate parameters and is intended for internal use.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-model

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-params

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric scalar. The log-likelihood value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{loglik_methods}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' trend <- list(location = FALSE, scale = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' loglik_fast(data, "GEV", params, years, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
loglik_fast <- function(data, model, params, years, trend) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the covariate from years 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    4165581x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get_covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
	# Minimal amount of error handling to prevent issues during MLE estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    4165581x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(params))) return (-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(data))) return (-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
	# Transform non-stationary parmaeters into a vector of stationary parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	if (trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    3576425x
                    
                      
		u <- params[1] + (covariate * params[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    589024x
                    
                      
		u <- params[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	i <- trend$location

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	if (trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    455438x
                    
                      
		s <- params[2 + i] + (covariate * params[3 + i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    3710011x
                    
                      
		s <- params[2 + i]

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Get shape parameter (will remain unused for 2-parameter distributions)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	k <- params[length(params)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Ensure that the scale parameter is positive

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	if (any(s <= 0)) return (-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Distribution functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	if (model == "GUM") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
		# Normalize the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    196496x
                    
                      
		z <- ((data - u) / s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    196496x
                    
                      
		ll <- -log(s) - z - exp(-z)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	} else if (model == "NOR") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
		# Normalize the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    32324x
                    
                      
		z <- ((data - u) / s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    32324x
                    
                      
		ll <- -log(s * sqrt(2 * pi)) - (z^2 / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	} else if (model == "LNO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
		# Normalize log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    40020x
                    
                      
		log_z <- ((log(data) - u) / s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
		# Subtract log(data) from ll because of the chain rule.

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    40020x
                    
                      
		ll <- -log(s * sqrt(2 * pi)) - (log_z^2 / 2) - log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	} else if (model == "GEV") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the shape-normalized data

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    3285951x
                    
                      
		t <- 1 + k * ((data - u) / s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
		# Check for support and then compute the log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    3285951x
                    
                      
		if (any(t <= 0)) return (-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    3274502x
                    
                      
		ll <- -log(s) - (1 + (1 / k)) * log(t) - t^(-1 / k)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    4165449x
                    
                      
	} else if (model == "GLO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the shape-normalized data

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    16877x
                    
                      
		t <- 1 - k * ((data - u) / s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
		# Check for support and then compute the log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    16877x
                    
                      
		if (any(t <= 0)) return (-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    15819x
                    
                      
		ll <- -log(s) + ((1 / k) - 1) * log(t) - 2 * log(1 + t^(1 / k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	}
