                    135x
                    
                      
	if (length(alpha) != 1) stop("'alpha' must have length 1")

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    133x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(alpha) | is.na(alpha))) stop("'alpha' must have no missing values")

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    131x
                    
                      
	if (alpha < 0.01 | alpha > 0.10) stop("'alpha' must be between 0.01 and 0.1")

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    129x
                    
                      
	return (alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Evaluate Goodness-of-Fit for Fitted Flood Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes multiple performance metrics and diagnostic indicators to assess the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' quality of a fitted flood frequency model This includes residual statistics,

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' information criteria, and coverage-based metrics using confidence intervals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-model

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-params

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param uncertainty List; estimated reutrn levels and confidence intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   generated by \link{uncertainty_bootstrap} or \link{uncertainty_rfpl}. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param pp.formula Character (1); string specifying the plotting position formula. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   Must be one of `"Weibull"`, `"Blom"`, `"Cunnane"`, `"Gringorten"`, or `"Hazen"`

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List containing model assessment metrics:

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `estimates`: Quantile estimates for empirical return periods.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' - `R2`: Coefficient of determination from linear regression of estimates vs. data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' - `RMSE`: Root mean squared error of quantile estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bias`: Mean bias of quantile estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' - `AIC`: Akaike Information Criterion.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' - `BIC`: Bayesian Information Criterion.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' - `AIC_MLL`: Akaike Information Criterion, computed using MLE.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' - `BIC_MLL`: Bayesian Information Criterion, computed using MLE.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' - `AW`: Average width of the confidence interval(s).

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' - `POC`: Percent of observations covered by the confidence interval(s).

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' - `CWI`: Confidence width index, a metric that combines `AW` and `POC`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{uncertainty_bootstrap}, \link{uncertainty_rfpl}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link{fit_maximum_likelihood}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples 

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize example data and params

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(100, 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' # Perform uncertainty analysis

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' uncertainty <- uncertainty_bootstrap(data, "NOR", "L-moments")

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' # Evaluate model diagnostics

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' model_diagnostics(data, "NOR", params, uncertainty)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats approx

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
model_diagnostics <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
  data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
  model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
  params,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
  uncertainty,

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
  years = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  trend = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
  alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  pp.formula = "Weibull"

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    7x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    7x
                    
                      
	model <- validate_model(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    7x
                    
                      
	params <- validate_params(params, model, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    7x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    7x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    7x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the slice from the uncertainty object

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    7x
                    
                      
	slice <- uncertainty$slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the number of data points 

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    7x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)                          

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	# Get information about the distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    7x
                    
                      
	info <- model_info(model, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize a list to store the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    7x
                    
                      
	results <- list(data = data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	# Compare with the method of plotting positions (S-FFA only)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    7x
                    
                      
	if (!trend$location && !trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
		# Sort the data vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
		data_sorted <- data[order(data, decreasing = TRUE)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
		# Determine empirical exceedance probabilities using the plotting position 

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_empirical <- switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    6x
                    
                      
			pp.formula, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    6x
                    
                      
			Weibull = (1:n) / (n + 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    6x
                    
                      
			Blom =  ((1:n) - 0.375) / (n + 0.25),

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    6x
                    
                      
			Cunnane = ((1:n) - 0.4) / (n + 0.2),

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    6x
                    
                      
			Gringorten = ((1:n) - 0.44) / (n + 0.12),

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    6x
                    
                      
			Hazen = ((1:n) - 0.5) / n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    6x
                    
                      
			stop("Unknown plotting position formula.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    6x
                    
                      
		t_return <- 1 / p_empirical               

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the estimates using the appropriate quantile function

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    6x
                    
                      
		estimates <- quantile_fast(1 - p_empirical, model, params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
		# Run linear regression against the sorted data

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    6x
                    
                      
		R2 <- summary(lm(estimates ~ data_sorted))$r.squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    6x
                    
                      
		RMSE <- sqrt(mean((estimates - data_sorted)^2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    6x
                    
                      
		bias <- mean(estimates - data_sorted)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the AIC and BIC

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    6x
                    
                      
		AIC <- n * log(RMSE) + (2 * info$n_params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    6x
                    
                      
		BIC <- n * log(RMSE) + (log(n) * info$n_params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
		# Filter t_return and x to indices where t_return is between 2 and 100

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    6x
                    
                      
		idx <- which(t_return > 2 & t_return < 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    6x
                    
                      
		t_return <- t_return[idx]

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    6x
                    
                      
		data_sorted <- data_sorted[idx]

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
		# Use log-linear interpolation to get confidence intervals for each return period

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    6x
                    
                      
		ci_lower <- approx(log(uncertainty$t), uncertainty$ci_lower, log(t_return))

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    6x
                    
                      
		ci_upper <- approx(log(uncertainty$t), uncertainty$ci_upper, log(t_return))

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the width and coverage of the confidence intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    6x
                    
                      
		widths <- ci_upper$y - ci_lower$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    6x
                    
                      
		covers <- sum(data_sorted < ci_upper$y & data_sorted > ci_lower$y)

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the AW, POC, and CWI

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    6x
                    
                      
		AW <- mean(widths)

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    6x
                    
                      
		POC <- 100 * covers / length(widths)

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    6x
                    
                      
		CWI <- AW * exp((1 - alpha) - (POC / 100))^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
		# Add summary statistics to results

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$estimates <- estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$R2 <- R2

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$RMSE <- RMSE

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$bias <- bias

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$AIC <- AIC

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$BIC <- BIC

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$AW <- AW

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$POC <- POC

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    6x
                    
                      
		results$CWI <- CWI

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the MLL AIC and BIC (S-FFA and NS-FFA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    7x
                    
                      
	MLL = fit_maximum_likelihood(data, model, years = years, trend = trend)$mll

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    7x
                    
                      
	results$MLL_AIC = (2 * info$n_params) - (2 * MLL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    7x
                    
                      
	results$MLL_BIC = (info$n_params * log(n)) - (2 * MLL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
	# Return assessment results in a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    7x
                    
                      
	results	

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Helper Function for Quantile Functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A helper function used by \link{quantile_methods}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p A numeric vector of probabilities. Must be between 0 and 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-model

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-params

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of quantiles with the same length as `p`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{quantile_methods}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize p, params, and trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' p <- runif(n = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' trend <- list(location = FALSE, scale = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the log-likelihood in the year 2000

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' quantile_fast(p, "GEV", params, 2000, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats qlnorm qgamma

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
quantile_fast <- function(p, model, params, slice, trend) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the covariate for the slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get_covariates(slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
	# Transform non-stationary parmaeters into a vector of stationary parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	if (trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    591764x
                    
                      
		u <- params[1] + (covariate * params[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    652908x
                    
                      
		u <- params[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	i <- trend$location

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	if (trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    376433x
                    
                      
		s <- params[2 + i] + (covariate * params[3 + i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    868239x
                    
                      
		s <- params[2 + i]

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# Get shape parameter (will remain unused for 2-parameter distributions)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	k <- params[length(params)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# The Kappa distribution uses two shape parameters and is always stationary

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	if (model == "KAP") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    235000x
                    
                      
		k <- params[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    235000x
                    
                      
		h <- params[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for GUM quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfgum <- function(p, u, s) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    171013x
                    
                      
		u - s * log(-log(p))

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for NOR quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfnor <- function(p, u, s) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    28016x
                    
                      
		qnorm(p, u, s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for LNO quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xflno <- function(p, u, s) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    25455x
                    
                      
		qlnorm(p, u, s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for GEV quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfgev <- function(p, u, s, k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    277862x
                    
                      
		if (k != 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    277860x
                    
                      
			u - s * (1 - (-log(p))^-k) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    2x
                    
                      
			u - s * log(-log(p))

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for GLO quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfglo <- function(p, u, s, k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    36102x
                    
                      
		if (k != 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    35836x
                    
                      
			u + s * (1 - ((1 - p) / p)^k) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    2x
                    
                      
			u - s * log((1 - p) / p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for GNO quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfgno <- function(p, u, s, k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    36003x
                    
                      
		if (k != 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    35936x
                    
                      
			u + s * (1 - exp(-k * qnorm(p))) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    1x
                    
                      
			qnorm(p, u, s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for PE3 quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfpe3 <- function(p, u, s, k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
		# Reparameterize in terms of a, b	

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    289519x
                    
                      
		a <- 4 / (k^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    289519x
                    
                      
		b <- abs((s * k) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
		# Vectorize three cases (k = 0, k > 0, k < 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    289519x
                    
                      
		if (k == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    4x
                    
                      
			qnorm(p, u, s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    289519x
                    
                      
		} else if (k > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    268608x
                    
                      
			u - (a * b) + qgamma(p, shape = a, scale = b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    289519x
                    
                      
		} else if (k < 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    19009x
                    
                      
			u + (a * b) - qgamma(1 - p, shape = a, scale = b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for LP3 quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xflp3 <- function(p, u, s, k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    20831x
                    
                      
		exp(xfpe3(p, u, s, k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for WEI quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfwei <- function(p, u, s, k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    145702x
                    
                      
		u + s * ((-log(1 - p))^(1/ k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for KAP quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	xfkap <- function(p, u, s, k, h) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    235000x
                    
                      
		u + (s / k) * (1 - ((1 - p^h) / h)^k)

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the result for all probabilities 

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    1244672x
                    
                      
	switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		GUM = xfgum(p, u, s),

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		NOR = xfnor(p, u, s),

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		LNO = xflno(p, u, s),

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		GEV = xfgev(p, u, s, k),

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		GLO = xfglo(p, u, s, k), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		GNO = xfgno(p, u, s, k),

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		PE3 = xfpe3(p, u, s, k),

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		LP3 = xflp3(p, u, s, k),

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		WEI = xfwei(p, u, s, k),

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    1244672x
                    
                      
		KAP = xfkap(p, u, s, k, h)

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Phillips–Perron Unit Root Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Applies the Phillips–Perron (PP) test to check for a unit root in annual

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' maximum streamflow (AMS) data. The null hypothesis is that the series contains a 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' unit root (and is thus non-stationary). This implementation of the PP test assumes 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' the time series has both stationary drift and a linear trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the test results, consisting of:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: The Z-statistic used to perform the test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: Reported p-value from the test. See notes on interpolation thresholds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If `TRUE`, the null hypothesis was rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' The implementation of this test is based on the \pkg{aTSA} package, which 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' interpolates p-values from a table of critical values presented in Fuller W. A. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' (1996). The critical values are only available for \eqn{\alpha \geq 0.01}. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' Therefore, a reported p-value of 0.01 indicates \eqn{p \leq 0.01}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' Fuller, W. A. (1996). Introduction to statistical time series, second ed., Wiley, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' New York.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{eda_kpss_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_pp_test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats embed

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
eda_pp_test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    6x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    6x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	# Construct time series yt and shifted time series yt1

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    6x
                    
                      
	z <- embed(data ,2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    6x
                    
                      
    yt <- z[,1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    6x
                    
                      
    yt1 <- z[,2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the number of Newey-West lags proportional to n^(1/4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    6x
                    
                      
    n <- length(yt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    6x
                    
                      
    q <- floor(4 * (n / 100)^0.25)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	# Create an autoregressive model with drift and trend 

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    6x
                    
                      
    t <- 1:n

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    6x
                    
                      
	model <- lm(yt ~ yt1 + t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the residuals, estimate for rho, and estimate for the SE of rho

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    6x
                    
                      
	residuals <- resid(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    6x
                    
                      
	rho <- summary(model)$coefficients[2,1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    6x
                    
                      
	se_rho <- summary(model)$coefficients[2,2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the variance of the residuals (with n-3 degrees of freedom)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    6x
                    
                      
	sigma <- sum(residuals^2)/(n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	# Calculate the sample autocovariances and store them in a vector gamma

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    6x
                    
                      
	gamma <- numeric(q + 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(q + 1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    26x
                    
                      
		u <- embed(residuals, i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    26x
                    
                      
		gamma[i] = sum(u[,1] * u[,i]) / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute an estimator of the long-run variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    6x
                    
                      
	lambda <- gamma[1] + 2 * sum((1 - 1:q / (q + 1)) * gamma[-1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the test statistic z_rho

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6x
                    
                      
	z_rho <- n * (rho - 1) - (n^2 * se_rho^2) / sigma * (lambda - gamma[1]) / 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	# Define table of Rho statistics from Fuller W. A. (1996) for model with drift and trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6x
                    
                      
    table_rho <- rbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    6x
                    
                      
		c(-22.5, -20.0, -17.9, -15.6, -8.49, -3.65, -2.51, -1.53, -0.46),

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    6x
                    
                      
        c(-25.8, -22.4, -19.7, -16.8, -8.80, -3.71, -2.60, -1.67, -0.67),

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    6x
                    
                      
        c(-27.4, -23.7, -20.6, -17.5, -8.96, -3.74, -2.63, -1.74, -0.76),

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    6x
                    
                      
        c(-28.5, -24.4, -21.3, -17.9, -9.05, -3.76, -2.65, -1.79, -0.83),

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    6x
                    
                      
        c(-28.9, -24.7, -21.5, -18.1, -9.08, -3.76, -2.66, -1.80, -0.86),

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
        c(-29.4, -25.0, -21.7, -18.3, -9.11, -3.77, -2.67, -1.81, -0.88)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
	# Define the columns, sizes, and quantiles used in the table

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    6x
                    
                      
	columns <- ncol(table_rho)

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    6x
                    
                      
	sizes <- c(25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    6x
                    
                      
	quantiles <- c(.01, .025, .05, .10, .50, .90, .95, .975, .99)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
	# Reduce table_rho to a 1D vector by interpolating on the sizes

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    6x
                    
                      
	interpolated_size <- numeric(columns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (j in 1:columns) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    54x
                    
                      
		interpolated_size[j] <- approx(sizes, table_rho[,j], n, rule = 2)$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
	# Interpolate the p-value from the 1D vector of rho statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_value <- approx(interpolated_size, quantiles, z_rho, rule = 2)$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    6x
                    
                      
	reject <- if (alpha == 0.10) p_value < alpha else p_value <= alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the P-value text to inform the user of the limited significance thresholds

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_text <- if (p_value == 0.01) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    5x
                    
                      
		"*at most* 0.01"

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    1x
                    
                      
		round(p_value, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    6x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    6x
                    
                      
		"Phillips-Perron",

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    6x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    6x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a unit root.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    6x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a unit root."

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    6x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    6x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    6x
                    
                      
		statistic = z_rho,

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    6x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
}
