                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Mann–Kendall–Sneyers (MKS) Test Results

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Constructs a two‐panel visualization of the MKS test. The upper panel plots the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' normalized progressive and regressive Mann–Kendall S‐statistics over time, with 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' dashed confidence bounds and potential trend‐change points. The lower panel 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' contains the annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data with the change points highlighted

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' points along with an optional trend line.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results A list generated by \link{eda_mks_test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param show_trend If `TRUE` (default), draw a fitted line through the AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Optional named arguments: 'title', 'top_xlabel', 'top_ylabel', 

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   'bottom_xlabel' and 'bottom_ylabel'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A \code{patchwork} object  with two \code{ggplot2} panels stacked vertically.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- eda_mks_test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' plot_mks_test(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{eda_mks_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @import patchwork

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
plot_mks_test <- function(results, show_trend = TRUE, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
	# Run parameter validation (see helpers.R)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    2x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(results$data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(results$years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a dataframe for the bounds

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    2x
                    
                      
	bound_df <- data.frame(y = c(-results$bound, results$bound))

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	# Create the plotting dataframe

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    2x
                    
                      
	df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    2x
                    
                      
		max = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
		year = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
		s_progressive = results$s_progressive,

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    2x
                    
                      
		s_regressive = results$s_regressive

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Capture optional arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
	args <- list(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Define labels for the plot 

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
    title <- "Mann-Kendall-Sneyers Test"

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    2x
                    
                      
	top_xlabel <- "Year" 

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    2x
                    
                      
	top_ylabel <- "Normalized Trend Statistic"

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
	bottom_xlabel <- "Year" 

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
	bottom_ylabel <- expression(AMS ~ m^3/s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
    # Override defaults if provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$title))  title  <- args$title

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$top_xlabel)) top_xlabel <- args$top_xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$top_ylabel)) top_ylabel <- args$top_ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$bottom_xlabel)) bottom_xlabel <- args$bottom_xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$bottom_ylabel)) bottom_ylabel <- args$bottom_ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
	# Plot the normalized trend statistics and confidence bands

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    2x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(x = .data$year)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_line(aes(color = "black", y = .data$s_progressive), linewidth = 1.2) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_line(aes(color = "gray",  y = .data$s_regressive), linewidth = 1.2) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_hline(

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    2x
                    
                      
			data = bound_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(yintercept = .data$y, color = "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    2x
                    
                      
			linetype = "dashed",

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_point(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    2x
                    
                      
			data = results$change_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(x =.data$year, y = .data$statistic, color = "blue"), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    2x
                    
                      
			size = 4

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    2x
                    
                      
		labs(title = title, x = top_xlabel, y = top_ylabel, color = "Legend") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    2x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    2x
                    
                      
			values = c("black" = "black","gray" = "gray","blue" = "blue","red" = "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    2x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("black", "gray", "red", "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    2x
                    
                      
			labels = c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    2x
                    
                      
				"Progressive Series",

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    2x
                    
                      
				"Regressive Series",

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    2x
                    
                      
				"Confidence Bounds", 

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    2x
                    
                      
				"Potential Trend Change"

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
	# Plot the change points on the original dataset

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    2x
                    
                      
	p2 <- ggplot(df, aes(x = .data$year, y = .data$max)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_point(aes(color = "black"), size = 2.25) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    2x
                    
                      
		(if (show_trend) geom_line(color = "black", linewidth = 1.1) else NULL) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_point(

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    2x
                    
                      
			data = results$change_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(x = .data$year, y = .data$max, color = "blue"), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    2x
                    
                      
			size = 4

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    2x
                    
                      
		labs(x = bottom_xlabel, y = bottom_ylabel, color = "Legend") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    2x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    2x
                    
                      
			values = c("black" = "black", "blue" = "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    2x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("black", "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    2x
                    
                      
			labels = c(bottom_ylabel, "Potential Trend Change")

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
		)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
	# Stack plots on top of each other and return

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    2x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1)) / add_theme(add_scales(p2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot L-Moment Ratio Diagram

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Generates a plot of L-moment ratios with the L-skewness on the x-axis and L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' on the y-axis. Plots the sample and log-sample L-moment ratios alongside the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' theoretical L-moment ratios for a set of candidate distributions. If the selection 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' method is \link{select_ldistance} or \link{select_lkurtosis}, the plot will include 

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' a small inset around the L-moment ratios of the recommended distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List of model selection results generated by \link{select_ldistance}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'  \link{select_lkurtosis}, or \link{select_zstatistic}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Optional named arguments: 'title', 'xlabel', and 'ylabel'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @return \code{ggplot}; plot object containing the L-moment ratio diagram, with:

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - L-moment ratio curves for each 3-parameter distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - Points for the L-moment ratios of each 2-parameter distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - Sample and log-sample L-moment ratio \eqn{(t_3, t_4)} points.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{select_ldistance}, \link{select_lkurtosis}, \link{select_zstatistic}

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- select_ldistance(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' plot_lmom_diagram(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom grDevices pdf

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
plot_lmom_diagram <- function(results, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
	# Run parameter validation (see helpers.R)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    4x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(results$data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
	# Get method name from the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    4x
                    
                      
	method <- results$method

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	# Create dataframes for the sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    4x
                    
                      
	reg_moments = lmom_sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    4x
                    
                      
	reg_sample_t3 = reg_moments[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    4x
                    
                      
	reg_sample_t4 = reg_moments[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    4x
                    
                      
	reg_lm <- data.frame(x = reg_sample_t3, y = reg_sample_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    4x
                    
                      
	log_moments = lmom_sample(log(data))

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    4x
                    
                      
	log_sample_t3 = log_moments[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    4x
                    
                      
	log_sample_t4 = log_moments[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    4x
                    
                      
	log_lm <- data.frame(x = log_sample_t4, y = log_sample_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate a dataframe with the moments for each distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    4x
                    
                      
	dlm <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    4x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GUM", "NOR", "LNO", "GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    36x
                    
                      
		info <- model_info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    36x
                    
                      
		if (info$n_params == 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    12x
                    
                      
			dm <- lmom_fast(model, c(0, 1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    12x
                    
                      
			dlm[[model]] = data.frame(x = dm[3], y = dm[4])

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
		else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
			# Generate a sequence of parameter sets to pass to a 3-parameter distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    24x
                    
                      
			k_seq <- seq(info$k_bounds[1], info$k_bounds[2], 0.001)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    24x
                    
                      
			params <- lapply(k_seq, function(i) c(0, 1, i))

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
			# Get a matrix of likelihood moment ratios for each parameter set in params

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    24x
                    
                      
			lmr <- lapply(params, function(p) suppressWarnings(lmom_fast(model, p)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    24x
                    
                      
			lmr <- do.call(rbind, lmr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
			# Return the t3 and t4 values as a dataframe

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    24x
                    
                      
			df = data.frame(x = lmr[, 3], y = lmr[, 4]) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    24x
                    
                      
			dlm[[model]] <- df[(!is.na(df$x) & !is.na(df$y)), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	# Initilaize the legend information

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    4x
                    
                      
	labels <- c("Sample", "Log-Sample", "GEV/GUM", "GLO", "GNO/NOR/LNO", "PE3/LP3", "WEI")

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    4x
                    
                      
	colors <- c("#000000", "#000000", "#e69f00", "#56b4e9", "#009e73", "#0072b2", "#d55e00")

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    4x
                    
                      
	shapes <- c(24, 15, 16, NA, 16, NA, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	# Capture optional arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    4x
                    
                      
	args <- list(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
    # Set default values

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    4x
                    
                      
	title <- paste(method, "Model Selection", sep = " ")

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    4x
                    
                      
	xlabel <- expression("L-skewness (" * tau[3] * ")")

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    4x
                    
                      
	ylabel <- expression("L-kurtosis (" * tau[4] * ")")

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
    # Override defaults if provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$title))  title  <- args$title

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$xlabel)) xlabel <- args$xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$ylabel)) ylabel <- args$ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    4x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = .data$x, y = .data$y)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$GEV, aes(color = "3"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$GLO, aes(color = "4"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$GNO, aes(color = "5"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$PE3, aes(color = "6"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$WEI, aes(color = "7"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = dlm$GUM, aes(color = "3"), shape = 16, size = 4) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = dlm$NOR, aes(color = "5"), shape = 16, size = 4) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = reg_lm, aes(color = "1"), shape = 24, size = 5, fill = "black") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    4x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = log_lm, aes(color = "2"), shape = 15, size = 5) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    4x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(labels = labels, values = colors) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    4x
                    
                      
		guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(shape = shapes))) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    4x
                    
                      
		labs(x = xlabel, y = ylabel, color = "Legend", title = title)

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
	# Add the theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    4x
                    
                      
	p1 <- add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
	# If the method is l-distance or l-kurtosis, draw a line to show the distance

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    4x
                    
                      
	if (method == "L-distance" | method == "L-kurtosis") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the sample point with the shortest distance from a distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    3x
                    
                      
		point <- if (results$recommendation %in% c("LNO", "LP3")) log_lm else reg_lm

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the recommended distribbution

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    3x
                    
                      
		df <- dlm[[results$recommendation]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the closest point on the (t3, t4) curve (L-distance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    3x
                    
                      
		if (method == "L-distance") { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    2x
                    
                      
			df$distance <- sqrt((df$x - point$x)^2 + (df$y - point$y)^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    2x
                    
                      
			df <- df[which.min(df$distance), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
		# Or get the point with the same t3 value (L-kurtosis)

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
		else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    1x
                    
                      
			df <- df[which.min(abs(df$x - point$x)), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    1x
                    
                      
			df$distance <- abs(df$y - point$y)

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
		# Dynamically set the radius of the magnified section

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    3x
                    
                      
		r <- df$distance * 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
		# Draw the inset plot: same layers, zoomed to [x +/- r, y +/- r]

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    3x
                    
                      
		p2 <- p1 +

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    3x
                    
                      
			geom_segment(data = point, aes(xend = df$x, yend = df$y)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    3x
                    
                      
			coord_cartesian(

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    3x
                    
                      
				xlim = c(point$x - r, point$x + r),

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    3x
                    
                      
				ylim = c(point$y - r, point$y + r)

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
		    ) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    3x
                    
                      
			theme_void() + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    3x
                    
                      
			theme(

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    3x
                    
                      
				legend.position = "none",

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    3x
                    
                      
				panel.border = element_rect(colour = "black", fill = NA, linewidth = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    3x
                    
                      
				plot.background = element_rect(colour = NA, fill = "white")

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
		# Turn the inset plot into a grob

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    3x
                    
                      
		p2_grob <- ggplotGrob(p2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
		# Place inset on main plot using annotation_custom()

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    3x
                    
                      
		p1 <- p1 +

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    3x
                    
                      
			geom_segment(data = point, aes(xend = 0.25, yend = 0.35)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    3x
                    
                      
			geom_segment(data = point, aes(xend = -0.25, yend = 0.35)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    3x
                    
                      
		    annotation_custom(

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    3x
                    
                      
				grob = p2_grob,

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    3x
                    
                      
				xmin = -0.25, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    3x
                    
                      
				xmax = 0.25,

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    3x
                    
                      
				ymin = 0.35, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    3x
                    
                      
				ymax = 0.60

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    4x
                    
                      
	p1 + coord_fixed(ratio = 2, xlim = c(-0.7, 0.7), ylim = c(0, 0.7))

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Mann–Kendall–Sneyers Test for Change Point Detection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the Mann–Kendall–Sneyers (MKS) test to detect the beginning of a monotonic

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' trend in annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data. The test computes normalized

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' progressive and regressive Mann–Kendall statistics and identifies statistically

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' significant crossing points, indicating potential change points in the trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `years`: The `years` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s_progressive`: Normalized progressive Mann–Kendall-Sneyers statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s_regressive`: Normalized regressive Mann–Kendall-Sneyers statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bound`: Critical confidence bound for significance based on `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `crossing_df`: Crossing points, including indices, years, statistics, and AMS.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `change_df`: Subset of `crossing.df` with statistically significant crossings.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p_value`: Two-sided p-value derived from the maximum crossing statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If `TRUE`, the null hypothesis of no change point is rejected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' The function computes progressive and regressive Mann–Kendall statistics \eqn{S_t},

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' normalized by their expected values and variances under the null hypothesis. The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' crossing points where the difference between these normalized statistics changes 

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' sign are identified using linear interpolation. The significance of detected 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' crossings is assessed using quantiles of the normal distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' Sneyers, R. (1990). On the statistical analysis of series of observations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' Technical note No. 143, World Meteorological Organization, Geneva.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{plot_mks_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_mks_test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats pnorm qnorm lm coef

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
eda_mks_test <- function(data, years, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    7x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    7x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    7x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    7x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute number of elements such that data[i] > data[j] for all j < i < t for all t.

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_statistic <- function(vt, data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		# Computes the number of elements such that data[i] > data[j] for j < i (given i).

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    14x
                    
                      
		sum_i <- function(i) sum(data[i] > data[1:i-1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
		# Applies the sum_i function to a vector values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    14x
                    
                      
		n_i <- sapply(vt, sum_i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute cumulative sum of n_i values to get the S-statistic for all t.

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    14x
                    
                      
		cumsum(n_i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the forward and backwards s-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    7x
                    
                      
	idx <- 1:length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_prog_non_normal <- s_statistic(idx, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_regr_non_normal <- s_statistic(idx, rev(data))

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the variance and expectation of the S-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_expectation = idx * (idx - 1) / 4

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_variance = (idx * (idx - 1) * ((2 * idx) + 5)) / 72

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Prevent a division by zero error at idx = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_variance[s_variance == 0] <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the normalized progressive and regressive s-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_prog <- (s_prog_non_normal - s_expectation) / sqrt(s_variance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_regr <- rev((s_regr_non_normal - s_expectation) / sqrt(s_variance))

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute confidence bounds for the normalized s-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    7x
                    
                      
	bound <- qnorm(1 - (alpha / 2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	# Find all crossings between progressive/regressive series

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	# Increment by one so that the crossing index is the start of the time series

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    7x
                    
                      
	s_sign <- sign(s_prog - s_regr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    7x
                    
                      
	cross <- which(s_sign[-1] != s_sign[-length(s_sign)]) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the location of each crossing using linear interpolation

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    7x
                    
                      
	get_crossings <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
		# Fit linear models 

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    18x
                    
                      
		fit_prog <- lm(s_prog[(i - 1):i] ~ years[(i - 1):i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    18x
                    
                      
		fit_regr <- lm(s_regr[(i - 1):i] ~ years[(i - 1):i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the slope and y-intercept of each line

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    18x
                    
                      
		b_prog <- coef(fit_prog)[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    18x
                    
                      
		b_regr <- coef(fit_regr)[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    18x
                    
                      
		m_prog <- coef(fit_prog)[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    18x
                    
                      
		m_regr <- coef(fit_regr)[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute and return y-coordinate of the intersection point

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    18x
                    
                      
		x_inter = (b_regr - b_prog) / (m_prog - m_regr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    18x
                    
                      
		y_inter = (m_prog * x_inter) + b_prog

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    18x
                    
                      
		as.numeric(y_inter)

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
	# Get crossing locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    7x
                    
                      
	locations <- if (length(cross) == 0) numeric() else sapply(cross, get_crossings)

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a dataframe of all crossings

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    7x
                    
                      
	crossing_df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    7x
                    
                      
		cross = cross,

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    7x
                    
                      
		year = years[cross],

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    7x
                    
                      
		statistic = locations,

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    7x
                    
                      
		max = data[cross]

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value of the test and the statistically significant crossings

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    7x
                    
                      
	if (nrow(crossing_df) > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    5x
                    
                      
		p_value <- 2 * (1 - pnorm(max(abs(crossing_df$statistic))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    5x
                    
                      
		change_df <- crossing_df[which(abs(crossing_df$statistic) > bound), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    2x
                    
                      
		p_value <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    2x
                    
                      
		change_df <- crossing_df

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    7x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    7x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    7x
                    
                      
		"Mann-Kendall-Sneyers",

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    7x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    7x
