		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    7x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    7x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of change point(s)",

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    7x
                    
                      
		sprintf("evidence of change point(s) at %s", toString(change_df$years))

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    7x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
	# Return a list of values results from the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    7x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    7x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    7x
                    
                      
		years = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    7x
                    
                      
		s_progressive = s_prog,

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    7x
                    
                      
		s_regressive = s_regr,

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    7x
                    
                      
		bound = bound,

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    7x
                    
                      
		crossing_df = crossing_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    7x
                    
                      
		change_df = change_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    7x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    7x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    7x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Helper Function for L-moments Ratios

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A helper function used by \link{lmom_theoretical}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' This function does not validate parameters and is intended for internal use.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @note L-moment ratios for `NOR`/`LNO` and `PE3`/`LP3` are identical since 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'   it L-moments for the `LNO`/`LP3` distributions are compared with the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   sample L-moments of the logarithm of the data internally. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-model

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-params

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of length 4 containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\lambda_1}: L-mean

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\lambda_2}: L-variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\tau_3}: L-skewness

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\tau_4}: L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{lmom_theoretical}

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J.R.M. & Wallis, J.R., 1997. Regional frequency analysis: an approach based 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' on L-Moments. Cambridge University Press, New York, USA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' lmom_fast("GLO", c(0, 1, 0))

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
lmom_fast <- function(model, params) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
	# Unpack the parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    347017x
                    
                      
	u <- params[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    347017x
                    
                      
	s <- params[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    347017x
                    
                      
	if (length(params) == 3) k <- params[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: -digamma(1) is Euler's constant (~0.5772)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    347017x
                    
                      
	if (model == "GUM") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    21x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u - (s * digamma(1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    21x
                    
                      
		l2 <- s * log(2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    21x
                    
                      
		t3 <- log(9 / 8) / log(2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    21x
                    
                      
		t4 <- (16 * log(2) - 10 * log(3)) / log(2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: We call lmom_fast("LNO", params) to compare the L-moments of log(data) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# to the L-moments for NOR. We can do this because Data ~ LNO <=> log(Data) ~ NOR.

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    347017x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "NOR" | model == "LNO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    38x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    38x
                    
                      
		l2 <- s * pi^-0.5

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    38x
                    
                      
		t3 <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    38x
                    
                      
		t4 <- (30 * pi^-1 * atan(sqrt(2))) - 9

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    347017x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "GEV") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    72586x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u + s * (1 - gamma(1 + k)) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    72586x
                    
                      
		l2 <- s * (1 - 2^-k) * gamma(1 + k) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    72586x
                    
                      
		t3 <- 2 * (1 - 3^-k) / (1 - 2^-k) - 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    72586x
                    
                      
		t4 <- (5 * (1 - 4^-k) - 10 * (1 - 3^-k) + 6 * (1 - 2^-k)) / (1 - 2^-k)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    347017x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "GLO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    8451x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u + s * ((1 / k) - (pi / sin(k * pi)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    8451x
                    
                      
		l2 <- (s * k * pi) / sin(k * pi)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    8451x
                    
                      
		t3 <- -k

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    8451x
                    
                      
		t4 <- (1 + (5 * k^2)) / 6

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    347017x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "GNO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
		# Constants for numerical approximation

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    32488x
                    
                      
		Tau04 <- 0.12260172

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    32488x
                    
                      
		A0 <-  0.4886025

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    32488x
                    
                      
		A1 <-  4.4493076e-3

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    32488x
                    
                      
		A2 <-  8.8027039e-4

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    32488x
                    
                      
		A3 <-  1.1507084e-6

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    32488x
                    
                      
		B1 <-  6.4662924e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    32488x
                    
                      
		B2 <-  3.3090406e-3

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    32488x
                    
                      
		B3 <-  7.4290680e-5

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    32488x
                    
                      
		C0 <-  0.1875659

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    32488x
                    
                      
		C1 <- -2.5352147e-3

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    32488x
                    
                      
		C2 <-  2.6995102e-4

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    32488x
                    
                      
		C3 <- -1.8446680e-6

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    32488x
                    
                      
		D1 <-  8.2325617e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    32488x
                    
                      
		D2 <-  4.2681448e-3

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    32488x
                    
                      
		D3 <-  1.1653690e-4

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    32488x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u + s * (1 - exp(k^2 / 2)) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    32488x
                    
                      
		l2 <- (s / k) * exp(k^2 / 2) * (1 - 2 * pnorm(-k / sqrt(2)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    32488x
                    
                      
		t3a <- A0 + A1 * k^2 + A2 * k^4 + A3 * k^6

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    32488x
                    
                      
		t3b <- 1 + B1 * k^2 + B2 * k^4 + B3 * k^6

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    32488x
                    
                      
		t3 <- -k * (t3a / t3b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    32488x
                    
                      
		t4a <- C0 + C1 * k^2 + C2 * k^4 + C3 * k^6

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    32488x
                    
                      
		t4b <- 1 + D1 * k^2 + D2 * k^4 + D3 * k^6

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    32488x
                    
                      
		t4 <- Tau04 + k^2 * (t4a / t4b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: We call lmom_fast("LP3", params) internally to compare the L-moments 

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
	# of log(data) to the L-moments for PE3 since  Data ~ LP3 <=> log(Data) ~ PE3.

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    347017x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "PE3" | model == "LP3") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
		# Coefficients used for approximation

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    160919x
                    
                      
		A0 <-  3.2573501e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    160919x
                    
                      
		A1 <-  1.6869150e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    160919x
                    
                      
		A2 <-  7.8327243e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    160919x
                    
                      
		A3 <- -2.9120539e-3

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    160919x
                    
                      
		B1 <-  4.6697102e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    160919x
                    
                      
		B2 <-  2.4255406e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    160919x
                    
                      
		C0 <-  1.2260172e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    160919x
                    
                      
		C1 <-  5.3730130e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    160919x
                    
                      
		C2 <-  4.3384378e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    160919x
                    
                      
		C3 <-  1.1101277e-2

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    160919x
                    
                      
		D1 <-  1.8324466e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    160919x
                    
                      
		D2 <-  2.0166036e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    160919x
                    
                      
		E1 <-  2.3807576

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    160919x
                    
                      
		E2 <-  1.5931792

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    160919x
                    
                      
		E3 <-  1.1618371e-1

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    160919x
                    
                      
		F1 <-  5.1533299

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    160919x
                    
                      
		F2 <-  7.1425260

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    160919x
                    
                      
		F3 <-  1.9745056

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    160919x
                    
                      
		G1 <-  2.1235833

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    160919x
                    
                      
		G2 <-  4.1670213

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    160919x
                    
                      
		G3 <-  3.1925299

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    160919x
                    
                      
		H1 <-  9.0551443

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    160919x
                    
                      
		H2 <-  2.6649995e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    160919x
                    
                      
		H3 <-  2.6193668e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
		# Reparameterize the distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    160919x
                    
                      
		a <- 4 / k^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    160919x
                    
                      
		b <- s * abs(k) / 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    160919x
                    
                      
		x <- u - (2 * s / abs(k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    160919x
                    
                      
		l1 <- x + (a * b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    160919x
                    
                      
		l2 <- (pi^-0.5) * b * exp(lgamma(a + 0.5) - lgamma(a))

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    160919x
                    
                      
		if (a >= 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    32811x
                    
                      
			t3 <- a^-0.5 * (A0 + A1 * a^-1 + A2 * a^-2 + A3 * a^-3) / (1 + B1 * a^-1 + B2 * a^-2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    32811x
                    
                      
			t4 <- (C0 + C1 * a^-1 + C2 * a^-2 + C3 * a^-3) / (1 + D1 * a^-1 + D2 * a^-2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    128108x
                    
                      
			t3 <- (1 + E1 * a + E2 * a^2 + E3 * a^3) / (1 + F1 * a + F2 * a^2 + F3 * a^3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    128108x
                    
                      
			t4 <- (1 + G1 * a + G2 * a^2 + G3 * a^3) / (1 + H1 * a + H2 * a^2 + H3 * a^3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
		# Flip the sign of t3 if k < 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    160919x
                    
                      
		if (k < 0) t3 <- -t3

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    347017x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
		# Reparameterize

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    72514x
                    
                      
		ug <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    72514x
                    
                      
		sg <- s / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    72514x
                    
                      
		kg <- 1 / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute L-moments for GEV

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    72514x
                    
                      
		l1g <- ug + sg * (1 - gamma(1 + kg)) / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    72514x
                    
                      
		l2g <- sg * (1 - 2^-kg) * gamma(1 + kg) / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    72514x
                    
                      
		t3g <- 2 * (1 - 3^-kg) / (1 - 2^-kg) - 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    72514x
                    
                      
		t4g <- (5 * (1 - 4^-kg) - 10 * (1 - 3^-kg) + 6 * (1 - 2^-kg)) / (1 - 2^-kg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute L-moments for Weibull

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    72514x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u + s - l1g

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    72514x
                    
                      
		l2 <- l2g

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    72514x
                    
                      
		t3 <- -t3g

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    72514x
                    
                      
		t4 <- t4g

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
	# Return results as a vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    347017x
                    
                      
	c(l1, l2, t3, t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Wald–Wolfowitz Runs Test for Randomness

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Applies the Wald–Wolfowitz runs test to a numeric vector of residuals in 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' order to assess whether they behave as a random sequence. The test statistic’s 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' p-value is compared to the significance level `alpha`, and a decision is 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' returned along with a human-readable summary message.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results A fitted linear model produced by \link{eda_sens_trend}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `residuals`: Numeric vector of residual values from a fitted linear model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `n`: The length of the residuals vector after removing the median.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `n_plus`, `n_minus`: The number of residuals above/below the median.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `runs`: The number of runs in the transformed sequence of residuals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: The runs test statistic, computed using `runs`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p_value`: P-value from the Wald–Wolfowitz runs test applied to residuals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If TRUE, the null hypothesis of random residuals is rejected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' The Wald–Wolfowitz runs test examines the sequence of residuals to test for

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' randomness around the median. A small p-value suggests non-random clustering, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' which may indicate that a linear model is inappropriate for the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Wald, A. and Wolfowitz, J. (1940). On a test whether two samples are from the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' same population. Annals of Mathematical Statistics, 11(2), 147–162.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{plot_runs_test}, \link{eda_sens_trend}

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' sens <- eda_sens_trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_runs_test(sens)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
eda_runs_test <- function(results, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    8x
                    
                      
	residuals <- validate_data(results$residuals, FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    8x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    8x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Remove values from the residuals that are equal to the median

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    8x
                    
                      
	filtered_residuals <- residuals[residuals != median(residuals)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Transform the residuals into a boolean vector (TRUE if >median, FALSE if <median)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    8x
                    
                      
	boolean_residuals <- (filtered_residuals > median(filtered_residuals))

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Count the number of data points in each category

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    8x
                    
                      
	n <- length(boolean_residuals)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    8x
                    
                      
	np <- sum(boolean_residuals == TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    8x
                    
                      
	nm <- sum(boolean_residuals == FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the number of "runs" (contiguous blocks of + or -) in the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    8x
                    
                      
	runs <- length(rle(boolean_residuals)$values)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the distribution parameters under the null hypothesis

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    8x
                    
                      
	mu <- (2 * np * nm / n) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    8x
                    
                      
	sigma <- sqrt((2 * np * nm * (2 * np * nm - n)) / ((n^2) * (n - 1)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value of the two-sided runs test

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    8x
                    
                      
	z <- (runs - mu) / sigma

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    8x
                    
                      
	p_value <- 2 * (1 - pnorm(abs(z)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    8x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    8x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    8x
                    
                      
		"runs",

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    8x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    8x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    8x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    8x
                    
                      
		"evidence that a linear model is inappropriate.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    8x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence that a linear model is inappropriate."

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    8x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    8x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    8x
                    
                      
		years = results$years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    8x
                    
                      
		residuals = residuals,

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    8x
                    
                      
		n = n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    8x
                    
                      
		n_plus = np,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    8x
                    
                      
		n_minus = nm,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    8x
                    
                      
		runs = runs,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    8x
                    
                      
		statistic = z,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    8x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    8x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    8x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' L-Distance Method for Distribution Selection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Selects a distribution from a set of candidate distributions by minimizing the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Euclidean distance between the theoretical L-moment ratios \eqn{(\tau_3, \tau_4)} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' and the sample L-moment ratios \eqn{(t_3, t_4)}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with the results of distribution selection:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - `method`: `"L-distance"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `metrics`: A list of L-distance metrics for each candidate distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `recommendation`: The name of the distribution with the smallest L-distance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' For each candidate distribution, the method computes the Euclidean distance between

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' sample L-moment ratios (\eqn{\tau_3}, \eqn{\tau_4}) and the closest point on the

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' theoretical distribution's L-moment curve. For two-parameter distributions (Gumbel,

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' Normal, Log-Normal), the theoretical L-moment ratios are compared directly with

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' the sample L-moment ratios. The distribution with the minimum distance is selected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' If a distribution is fit to log-transformed data (Log-Normal or Log-Pearson Type 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' III), the L-moment ratios for the log-transformed sample are used instead.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{lmom_sample}, \link{select_lkurtosis}, \link{select_zstatistic}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link{plot_lmom_diagram}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' select_ldistance(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats optim

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
select_ldistance <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    7x
                    
                      
	validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the sample L-moments for data and log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    7x
                    
                      
	reg_t3_t4 <- lmom_sample(data)[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    7x
                    
                      
	log_t3_t4 <- lmom_sample(log(data))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function to get distance between two points

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    7x
                    
                      
	distance <- function(p1, p2) sqrt((p1[1] - p2[1])^2 + (p1[2] - p2[2])^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize list of metrics

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    7x
                    
                      
	metrics <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through the list of distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    7x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GUM", "NOR", "LNO", "GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
		# Get distribution information

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    63x
                    
                      
		info <- model_info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
		# Determine the sample L-moments (regular or log)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    63x
                    
                      
		t3_t4 <- if (info$log) log_t3_t4 else reg_t3_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the L-distance metric directly for two-parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    63x
                    
                      
		if (info$n_params == 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    21x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmom_fast(model, c(0, 1))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    21x
                    
                      
			metrics[[model]] <- distance(tau3_tau4, t3_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    21x
                    
                      
			next

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
		# Define objective function for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    42x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    708x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmom_fast(model, c(0, 1, i))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    708x
                    
                      
			distance(tau3_tau4, t3_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
		# Run optimization for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    42x
                    
                      
		result <- optim(

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    42x
                    
                      
			par = (info$k_bounds[1] + info$k_bounds[2]) / 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    42x
                    
                      
			fn = objective,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    42x
                    
                      
			method = "Brent",

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    42x
                    
                      
			lower = info$k_bounds[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    42x
                    
                      
			upper = info$k_bounds[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    42x
                    
                      
		metrics[[model]] <- result$value

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the recommendation (distribution with lowest L-distance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    7x
                    
                      
	recommendation <- names(metrics)[which.min(metrics)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    7x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    7x
                    
                      
		method = "L-distance",

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    7x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    7x
                    
                      
		metrics = metrics,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    7x
                    
                      
		recommendation = recommendation

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
	)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Z-Statistic Method for Distribution Selection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Selects the best-fit distribution by computing a bias-corrected Z-statistic for 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' the sample L-kurtosis (\eqn{\tau_4}) against the theoretical L-moments for a set 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' of candidate distributions. The distribution with the smallest absolute Z-statistic 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' is selected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-samples

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with the results of distribution selection:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `method`: `"Z-selection"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `metrics`: List of computed Z-statistics for each candidate distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `recommendation`: Name of the distribution with the smallest Z-statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reg_params`: Kappa distribution parameters for the AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reg_bias_t4`: Bias of the L-kurtosis from the AMS bootstrap.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reg_std_t4`: Standard deviation of the L-kurtosis from the AMS bootstrap.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `log_params`: Kappa distribution parameters for the log-AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `log_bias_t4`: Bias of the L-kurtosis from the log-AMS bootstrap.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `log_std_t4`: Standard deviation of the L-kurtosis from the log-AMS bootstrap.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' The method performs model selection using both raw and log-transformed data. The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' distributions which use the raw AMS data are GEV, GLO, PE3, GNO, and WEI. The LP3

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' distribution uses log-transformed data. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
