	sum((n * pll) + llv)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Quantile Functions for Probability Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the quantiles for stationary and non-stationary variants  of nine 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' different distributions: `"GUM"`, `"NOR"`, `"LNO"`, `"GEV"`, `"GLO"`, `"GNO"`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' `"PE3"`, `"LP3"`, or `"WEI"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p Numeric; a vector of probabilities between 0 and 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-params

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-slice

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of quantiles with the same length as `p`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{quantile_fast}

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize p and params

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' p <- runif(n = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' quantile_wei(p, params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @name quantile_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname quantile_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
quantile_gum <- function(p, params, slice = 1900, trend = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
	p <- validate_probabilities(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    2x
                    
                      
	params <- validate_params(params, "GUM", trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    2x
                    
                      
	slice <- validate_slice(slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    2x
                    
                      
	quantile_fast(p, "GUM", params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname quantile_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
quantile_nor <- function(p, params, slice = 1900, trend = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
	p <- validate_probabilities(p)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
	params <- validate_params(params, "NOR", trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    2x
                    
                      
	slice <- validate_slice(slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
	quantile_fast(p, "NOR", params, slice, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname quantile_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    53

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Sen's Trend Estimator

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes Sen's trend estimator for a univariate time series.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the estimated trend:

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - `years`: The `years` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `slope`: Median slope of all pairwise data-year combinations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `intercept`: Median intercept estimate of the fitted line.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `residuals`: Vector of residuals between observed and fitted values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the results.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' Sen's slope estimator is a robust, non-parametric trend estimator computed from 

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' the median of all pairwise slopes between data points. The corresponding intercept 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' is taken as the median of residual-corrected values. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' Sen, P.K. (1968). Estimates of the regression coefficient based on Kendall's tau.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' \emph{Journal of the American Statistical Association}, 63(324), 1379–1389. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{eda_runs_test}, \link{plot_sens_trend}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_sens_trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats median

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
eda_sens_trend <- function(data, years, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    36x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    36x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    36x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the length of data for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    36x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	# Convert the years into covariates

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    36x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get_covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute all pairwise slopes

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    36x
                    
                      
	slopes <- c()

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    36x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(n-1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2582x
                    
                      
		for (j in (i+1):n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    120464x
                    
                      
			m <- (data[j] - data[i]) / (covariate[j] - covariate[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    120464x
                    
                      
			slopes <- c(slopes, m)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimate for the slope

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    36x
                    
                      
	sens_slope <- median(slopes, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimate for the intercept

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    36x
                    
                      
	intercepts <- data - (sens_slope * covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    36x
                    
                      
	sens_intercept <- median(intercepts, na.rm =  TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the predicted AMS values and the residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    36x
                    
                      
	predicted_data <- sens_intercept + (sens_slope * covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    36x
                    
                      
	residuals <- data - predicted_data

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of Sen's trend estimator

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    36x
                    
                      
	m <- round(sens_slope, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    36x
                    
                      
	b <- round(sens_intercept, 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    36x
                    
                      
	msg <- sprintf("Estimated trend: y = %fx + %f.", m, b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    36x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    36x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    36x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    36x
                    
                      
		years = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    36x
                    
                      
		slope = sens_slope,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    36x
                    
                      
		intercept = sens_intercept,

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    36x
                    
                      
		residuals = residuals,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    36x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Mann–Kendall Trend Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the Mann–Kendall trend test on a numeric vector to detect the presence 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' of a monotonic trend (increasing or decreasing) over time. The test is 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' non-parametric and accounts for tied observations in the data. The null

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' hypothesis assumes there is no monotonic trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s_statistic`: The Mann–Kendall test statistic \eqn{S}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s_variance`: The variance of the test statistic under the null hypothesis.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p_value`: The p-value associated with the two-sided hypothesis test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If `TRUE`, the null hypothesis is rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: A character string summarizing the result, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' The statistic \eqn{S} is computed as the sum over all pairs \eqn{i < j} of the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' sign of the difference \eqn{x_j - x_i}. Ties are explicitly accounted for when 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' calculating the variance of \eqn{S}, using grouped frequencies of tied observations. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' The test statistic \eqn{Z} is then computed based on the sign and magnitude of 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' \eqn{S}, and the p-value is derived from the standard normal distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{eda_bbmk_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_mk_test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats pnorm

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
eda_mk_test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    10x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    10x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    10x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    10x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the test statistic S by iterating through all pairs of values in data

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    10x
                    
                      
	s <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    10x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(n-1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    948x
                    
                      
		for (j in (i+1):n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    45595x
                    
                      
			s = s + sign(data[j] - data[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	# Identify tied groups and find the number of elements in each group

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    10x
                    
                      
	freqs <- table(data)        

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    10x
                    
                      
	ties <- freqs[freqs > 1]    

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    10x
                    
                      
	g <- length(ties)           

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    10x
                    
                      
	tp <- as.vector(ties)       

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the the S-variance including the contribution from groups

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    10x
                    
                      
	group_sum <- sum(tp * (tp - 1) * (2 * tp + 5))

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    10x
                    
                      
	s_variance <- (1 / 18) * ((n * (n-1) * (2 * n + 5)) - group_sum)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the normalized test statistic Z

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    10x
                    
                      
	z <- if (s > 0) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    4x
                    
                      
		(s - 1) / sqrt(s_variance) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    10x
                    
                      
	} else if (s == 0) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
                    
                      
		0 

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	} else { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    5x
                    
                      
		(s + 1) / sqrt(s_variance) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value for a two-sided test

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    10x
                    
                      
	p_value <- 2 * pnorm(abs(z), lower.tail=FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    10x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    10x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    10x
                    
                      
		"Mann-Kendall",

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    10x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    10x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    10x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    10x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a monotonic trend",

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    10x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a monotonic trend"

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    10x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    10x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    10x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    10x
                    
                      
		s_statistic = s,

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    10x
                    
                      
		s_variance = s_variance,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    10x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    10x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    10x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Decompose Annual Maximum Streamflow Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Removes trends in the mean and/or variance of annual maximum streamflow (AMS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' data using Sen’s trend estimator and/or a moving‐window estimator of the variance. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' Four scenarios are supported:

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. No trend. The data is returned unmodified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. Trend in the mean only.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. Trend in the variance only.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. Trends in both the mean and the variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' Internally, the function does the following:

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. Compute `covariate = (years - 1900) / 100`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. If there is a trend in the location, fit Sen’s trend estimator to 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'    `data` and `covariate`. Then, remove the fitted linear trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. If there is a trend in the scale, compute the moving‐window variance using 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'    \link{ams_mw_variance}, fit Sen’s trend estimator to those variances, and then 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'    rescales the series to remove trends in the scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. If necessary, shift the data so that its minimum is at least 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric vector of decomposed AMS data with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{ams_mw_variance}, \link{eda_sens_trend}

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' trend <- list(location = TRUE, scale = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' ams_decomposition(data, years, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
ams_decomposition <- function(data, years, trend) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    16x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    16x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    16x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    16x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get_covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    16x
                    
                      
	decomposed <- data

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Remove trends in location first to get rid of excess variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    16x
                    
                      
	if (trend$location) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    10x
                    
                      
		sens <- eda_sens_trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    10x
                    
                      
		decomposed <- data - (covariate * sens$slope)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    16x
                    
                      
	if (trend$scale) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    10x
                    
                      
		variance <- ams_mw_variance(decomposed, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    10x
                    
                      
        sens <- eda_sens_trend(variance$std, variance$year)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    10x
                    
                      
        gt <- ((sens$slope * covariate) + sens$intercept) / sens$intercept

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    10x
                    
                      
		mu <- mean(decomposed, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
		# To remove variance around the mean, data must have mean 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    10x
                    
                      
        decomposed <- mu + ((decomposed - mu) / gt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	# Enforce positivity since negative data causes issues elsewhere

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    16x
                    
                      
	if (any(decomposed < 1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    3x
                    
                      
		decomposed <- decomposed - min(decomposed) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    16x
                    
                      
	decomposed

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Block‐Bootstrap Mann–Kendall Test Results

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Generates a histogram of bootstrapped Mann–Kendall S‐statistics with vertical

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' lines indicating the observed S‐statistic and confidence bounds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List of BB‐MK test results generated by \link{eda_bbmk_test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Optional named arguments: 'title', 'xlabel', and 'ylabel'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @return \code{ggplot}; A plot containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   - A gray histogram of the distribution of bootstrapped S‐statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   - A red vertical line at the lower and upper confidence bounds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   - A black vertical line at the observed S‐statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- eda_bbmk_test(data, samples = 1000L)

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' plot_bbmk_test(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
plot_bbmk_test <- function(results, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
	# Capture optional arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    2x
                    
                      
	args <- list(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
    # Set default values

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    2x
                    
                      
    title <- "Block-Bootstrap Mann-Kendall Test"

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    2x
                    
                      
    xlabel <- "S-Statistic"

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
    ylabel <- "Frequency"

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
    # Override defaults if provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$title))  title  <- args$title

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$xlabel)) xlabel <- args$xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$ylabel)) ylabel <- args$ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    2x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_histogram(

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(x = results$s_bootstrap, color = "gray"), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
			fill = "lightgray",

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
			bins = 30

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
		)  +

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_vline(

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(xintercept = results$bounds, color = "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.2

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_vline(

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(xintercept = results$s_statistic, color = "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.2

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    2x
                    
                      
		labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
			title = title,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
			x = xlabel,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
			y = ylabel,

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2x
                    
                      
			color = "Legend"

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    2x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    2x
                    
                      
			values = c("gray" = "gray", "black" = "black", "red" = "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    2x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("gray", "black", "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    2x
                    
                      
			labels = c("Bootstrapped Statistics", "S-Statistic", "Confidence Bounds"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot with added theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    2x
                    
                      
	add_theme(p1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
# Helper function for getting information about distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
model_info <- function(model, trend = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    385574x
                    
                      
	info <- switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    385574x
                    
                      
		model,	

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"GUM" = list(n_params = 2, log = FALSE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"NOR" = list(n_params = 2, log = FALSE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"LNO" = list(n_params = 2, log =  TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"GEV" = list(n_params = 3, log = FALSE, k_bounds = c(-9, 9)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"GLO" = list(n_params = 3, log = FALSE, k_bounds = c(-0.999, 0.999)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"PE3" = list(n_params = 3, log = FALSE, k_bounds = c(-10, 10)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"LP3" = list(n_params = 3, log =  TRUE, k_bounds = c(-10, 10)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"GNO" = list(n_params = 3, log = FALSE, k_bounds = c(-4, 4)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"WEI" = list(n_params = 3, log = FALSE, k_bounds = c(-9, 9)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    385574x
                    
                      
		"KAP" = list(n_params = 4, log = FALSE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
	# If optional trend parameter is given, update the number of parameters 

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    385574x
                    
                      
	if (!is.null(trend)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    55x
                    
                      
		info$n_params <- info$n_params + trend$location + trend$scale

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    385574x
                    
                      
	info

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
# Helper function for computing covariates. A covariate is a normalized version of 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
# the year where 0 corresponds to the first year and 1 is the last year. Covariates

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
# are used to fit parameters for non-stationary distributions.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    5535809x
                    
                      
get_covariates <- function(years) (years - 1900) / 100

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
# Adds sensible axis scales to a plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
add_scales <- function(p) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    22x
                    
                      
	p + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    22x
                    
                      
	scale_x_continuous(breaks = function(limits) pretty(limits, n = 10)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    22x
                    
                      
	scale_y_continuous(breaks = function(limits) pretty(limits, n = 10))

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
# Adds sensible styling to a plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
add_theme <- function(p) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    27x
                    
                      
	p +

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    27x
                    
                      
	theme_minimal() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    27x
                    
                      
	theme(

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    27x
                    
                      
		plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA),

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    27x
                    
                      
		plot.title = element_text(size = 20, hjust = 0.5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    27x
                    
                      
		plot.margin = margin(5, 15, 5, 15),

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    27x
                    
                      
		axis.title = element_text(size = 16),

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    27x
                    
                      
		axis.text = element_text(size = 12),

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    27x
                    
                      
		panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    27x
                    
                      
		legend.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    27x
                    
                      
		legend.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    27x
                    
                      
		legend.box.background = element_rect(color = "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    27x
                    
                      
		legend.direction = "vertical"

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
