                    27
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
# Adds a nicely formatted annotation to the top right corner of a plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
add_annotation <- function(p, label) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    6x
                    
                      
	grob <- textGrob(label)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    6x
                    
                      
	rect_w <- 0.22

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    6x
                    
                      
	rect_h <- 0.04

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    6x
                    
                      
	p + annotation_custom(

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    6x
                    
                      
		grob = grobTree(

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    6x
                    
                      
			rectGrob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    6x
                    
                      
				x = 0.95 - (rect_w / 2), y = 0.95,

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    6x
                    
                      
				hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5,

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    6x
                    
                      
				width = rect_w,

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    6x
                    
                      
				height = rect_h,

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    6x
                    
                      
				gp = gpar(fill = "white", col = "black")

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
			),

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    6x
                    
                      
			textGrob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    6x
                    
                      
				label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    6x
                    
                      
				x = 0.95 - (rect_w / 2), y = 0.95,

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    6x
                    
                      
				hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5 ,

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    6x
                    
                      
				gp = gpar(col = "black", fontsize = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
		),

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    6x
                    
                      
		xmin = -Inf, xmax = Inf, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Kwiatkowski–Phillips–Schmidt–Shin (KPSS) Unit Root Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the KPSS unit root test on annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' The null hypothesis is that the time series is trend-stationary with a linear 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' trend and constant drift. The alternative hypothesis is that the time series 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' has a unit root and is non-stationary.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: The KPSS test statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p_value`: The interpolated p-value. See note regarding discrete thresholds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical scalar. If, TRUE the null hypothesis is rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test outcome, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' The implementation of the KPSS test is based on the \pkg{aTSA} package, which 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' interpolates a significance table from Hobjin et al. (2004). Therefore, a result 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' of \eqn{p = 0.01} implies that \eqn{p \leq 0.01} and a result of \eqn{p = 0.10} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' implies that \eqn{p \geq 0.10}. This implementation uses the Type III KPSS test,

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' which accounts for a linear trend in the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{eda_pp_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Hobijn, B., Franses, P.H. and Ooms, M. (2004), Generalizations of the KPSS-test 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' for stationarity. Statistica Neerlandica, 58: 483-502. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_kpss_test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats embed

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
eda_kpss_test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    6x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    6x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    6x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	# Construct time series yt/yt1 for fitting the autoregressive model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    6x
                    
                      
	z <- embed(data, 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    6x
                    
                      
	yt <- z[,1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    6x
                    
                      
	yt1 <- z[,2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the number of lags using the standard choice, proportional to sqrt(n)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    6x
                    
                      
	n <- length(yt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    6x
                    
                      
	q <- max(1, floor(3 * sqrt(n) / 13))

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Create an autoregressive model with drift + trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    6x
                    
                      
	t <- 1:n

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    6x
                    
                      
    model <- lm(yt ~ yt1 + t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the residuals and their cumulative sum of squares

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    6x
                    
                      
	residuals <- resid(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    6x
                    
                      
	Sk <- cumsum(residuals)^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the sample autocovariances

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    6x
                    
                      
	gamma <- numeric(q + 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(q + 1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    21x
                    
                      
		u <- embed(residuals,i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    21x
                    
                      
		gamma[i] = sum(u[,1] * u[,i]) / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute an estimator of the long-run variance 

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6x
                    
                      
	lambda_hat <- gamma[1] + 2 * sum((1 - 1:q/(q + 1))*gamma[-1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    6x
                    
                      
	statistic <- sum(Sk) / (lambda_hat * n^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	# Table of quantiles and test statistic values from Hobjin et al. (2004)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    6x
                    
                      
	quantiles <- c(0.10, 0.05, 0.025, 0.01)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6x
                    
                      
    table <- c(0.119, 0.146, 0.176, 0.216)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	# Interpolate the p-value using the table above

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_value <- approx(table, quantiles, statistic, rule = 2)$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    6x
                    
                      
	reject <- if (alpha == 0.10) p_value < alpha else p_value <= alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_text <- if (p_value == 0.10) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    4x
                    
                      
		"at least 0.10"

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
	} else if (p_value == 0.01) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1x
                    
                      
		"at most 0.01"

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    1x
                    
                      
		round(p_value, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    6x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    6x
                    
                      
		"KPSS",

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    6x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    6x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a unit root.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    6x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a unit root."

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    6x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    6x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    6x
                    
                      
		statistic = statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    6x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Block-Bootstrap Mann-Kendall Test for Trend Detection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs a bootstrapped version of the Mann-Kendall trend test to account

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' for serial correlation in annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data. The procedure

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' uses Spearman’s autocorrelation test to estimate the least insignificant lag, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' then applies a bootstrap procedure to obtain the empirical p-value and confidence 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' bounds for the Mann-Kendall S-statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-samples

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the results of the test, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s_bootstrap`: Vector of bootstrapped test statistics used for plotting.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s_statistic`: The Mann-Kendall test statistic computed on the original series.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p_value`: Empirical two-sided p-value computed from the bootstrap distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bounds`: Confidence interval bounds for the null distribution of the statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If `TRUE`, the null hypothesis was rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' The block size for the bootstrap is selected as `least_lag + 1`, where `least_lag` 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' is estimated using \link{eda_spearman_test}. Each bootstrap sample is generated by 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' resampling blocks of the original data  (without replacement) and computing the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' Mann-Kendall S-statistic. This procedure adjusts for autocorrelation in the data. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{plot_bbmk_test}, \link{eda_mk_test}, \link{eda_spearman_test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_bbmk_test(data, samples = 1000L)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats quantile

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
eda_bbmk_test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, samples = 10000L, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    4x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    4x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    4x
                    
                      
	samples <- validate_samples(samples)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    4x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    4x
                    
                      
	least_lag <- eda_spearman_test(data, alpha)$least_lag

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    4x
                    
                      
	s_statistic  <- eda_mk_test(data, alpha)$s_statistic

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Blocks have size of least_lag + 1 to remove autocorrelation 

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    4x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    4x
                    
                      
	size <- least_lag + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    4x
                    
                      
	n_blocks <- ceiling(n / size)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    4x
                    
                      
	blocks <- split(data[1:(n_blocks * size)], rep(1:n_blocks, each = size))

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    4x
                    
                      
	bootstrap_results <- sapply(1:samples, function(i) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		# Sample blocks without replacement

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    20200x
                    
                      
		sampled_blocks <- sample(blocks, n_blocks, replace = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    20200x
                    
                      
		sampled_data <- unlist(sampled_blocks, use.names = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the Mann-Kendall statistic for the bootstrap

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    20200x
                    
                      
		m <- outer(sampled_data, sampled_data, `-`)                   

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    20200x
                    
                      
  		sum(sign(m[lower.tri(m)]), na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# The p-value is computed empirically using the bootstrap distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    4x
                    
                      
	p_value <- ifelse(

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    4x
                    
                      
		s_statistic < 0, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    4x
                    
                      
		2 * mean(s_statistic >= bootstrap_results),

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    4x
                    
                      
		2 * mean(s_statistic <= bootstrap_results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	# The confidence interval bounds are determined empirically from the bootstrap

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    4x
                    
                      
	bounds <- quantile(bootstrap_results, c(alpha / 2, 1 - (alpha / 2)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    4x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    4x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    4x
                    
                      
		"BBMK",

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    4x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    4x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    4x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    4x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a trend given the serial correlation.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    4x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a trend given the serial correlation."

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    4x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    4x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    4x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    4x
                    
                      
		s_bootstrap = bootstrap_results,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    4x
                    
                      
		s_statistic = s_statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    4x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    4x
                    
                      
		bounds = bounds,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    4x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    4x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Spearman’s Rho Autocorrelation

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Visualizes Spearman’s rho autocorrelation coefficients with shaded points 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' indicating statistical significance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results A list generated by \link{eda_spearman_test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Optional named arguments: 'title', 'xlabel', and 'ylabel'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `ggplot`; a plot showing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - Vertical segments from \eqn{y=0} up to each \eqn{\rho} value at its lag.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - Filled circles at each lag, filled black if serial correlation is detected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- eda_spearman_test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' plot_spearman_test(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
plot_spearman_test <- function(results, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
	# Create dataframe for generating the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    2x
                    
                      
	rho_df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    2x
                    
                      
		lag = 1:length(results$rho),

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    2x
                    
                      
		rho = results$rho,

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    2x
                    
                      
		sig = results$sig

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
	# Capture optional arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
	args <- list(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
    # Set default values

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
    title <- "Spearman's Rho Autocorrelation"

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    2x
                    
                      
    xlabel <- "Lag"

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    2x
                    
                      
    ylabel <- "Spearman's Rho"

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
    # Override defaults if provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$title))  title  <- args$title

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$xlabel)) xlabel <- args$xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$ylabel)) ylabel <- args$ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# First subplot: Spearman's Rho Autocorrelation

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    2x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(rho_df, aes(x = .data$lag, y = .data$rho)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_segment(

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(x = .data$lag, xend = .data$lag, y = 0, yend = .data$rho)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_point(

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(fill = .data$sig),

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
			shape = 21,

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
			size = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    2x
                    
                      
			stroke = 1.2

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
		labs(title = title, x = xlabel, y = ylabel, fill = "Legend") + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
		scale_fill_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
			values = c(`TRUE` = "black", `FALSE` = "white"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2x
                    
                      
			labels = c("No Serial Correlation", "Serial Correlation"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot with added theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    2x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
 

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' White Test for Heteroskedasticity

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the White test for heteroskedasticity by regressing the squared residuals 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' of a linear model on the original regressors and their squared terms. The null 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' hypothesis is homoskedasticity.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-quiet

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list containing the results of the White test:

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `data`: The `data` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `years`: The `years` argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `r_squared`: Coefficient of determination from the auxiliary regression.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: White test statistic based on sample size and `r.squared`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p_value`: The p-value derived from a Chi-squared distribution with `df = 2`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. If `TRUE`, the null hypothesis is rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' The White test regresses the squared residuals from a primary linear model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' `lm(data ~ years)` against both the original regressor and its square. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' The test statistic is calculated as \eqn{nR^2}, where \eqn{R^2} is the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' coefficient of determination from the auxiliary regression. Under the null hypothesis,

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' this statistic follows a \eqn{\chi^2} distribution with 2 degrees of freedom.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' Rejection of the null hypothesis suggests heteroskedasticity in the residuals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @references White, H. (1980). A heteroskedasticity-consistent covariance matrix 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' estimator and a direct test for heteroskedasticity. \emph{Econometrica}, 48(4), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' 817–838.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link[stats]{lm}, \link[stats]{pchisq}

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' eda_white_test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats lm pchisq resid

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
eda_white_test <- function(data, years, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    5x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    5x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    5x
                    
                      
	alpha <- validate_alpha(alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    5x
                    
                      
	quiet <- validate_quiet(quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Do a linear regression of data against years, get the squared residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    5x
                    
                      
	primary_model <- lm(data ~ years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    5x
                    
                      
	squared_residuals <- resid(primary_model)^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	# Fit an auxillary model to the squared residuals, get the R^2 statistic

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    5x
                    
                      
	auxillary_model <- lm(squared_residuals ~ years + I(years^2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    5x
                    
                      
	r_squared <- summary(auxillary_model)$r.squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the test statistic and p-value

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    5x
                    
                      
	statistic <- length(data) * r_squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    5x
                    
                      
	p_value <- 1 - pchisq(statistic, df = 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    5x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    5x
                    
                      
	msg <- stats_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    5x
                    
                      
		"White",

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    5x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    5x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    5x
                    
                      
		"evidence of heteroskedasticity",

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    5x
                    
                      
		"evidence of homoskedasticity"

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    5x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    5x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    5x
                    
                      
		data = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    5x
                    
                      
		years = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    5x
                    
                      
		r_squared = r_squared,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    5x
                    
                      
		statistic = statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    5x
                    
                      
		p_value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    5x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
# Generates an informational message about a statistical test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
stats_message <- function(name, reject, p_value, alpha, msg_fail, msg_reject) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    53x
                    
                      
	s1 <- if(reject) "reject the null" else "fail to reject the null"

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    53x
                    
                      
	s2 <- if(reject) msg_reject else msg_fail

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    53x
                    
                      
	l1 <- sprintf("The %s test had a p-value of %.4f.", name, round(p_value, 3))

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    53x
                    
                      
	l2 <- sprintf("At a significance level of %.2f, we %s hypothesis.", alpha, s1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    53x
                    
                      
	l3 <- sprintf("Therefore, there is %s.", s2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
	# Combine the messages and add bullet points

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    53x
                    
                      
	paste0("\n - ", c(l1, l2, l3), collapse = "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Model Assessment Results

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Creates a quantile–quantile plot comparing observed annual maximum streamflow (AMS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' data to quantile estimates from a fitted parametric model. The 1:1 line is drawn in 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' black and the model estimates are plotted as semi‐transparent red points.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; model assessment results generated by \link{model_diagnostics}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... Optional named arguments: 'title', 'xlabel', and 'ylabel'.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return \code{ggplot}; a plot containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - A black line representing a perfect model with no deviation from the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - Red points marking the estimated quantiles against the observed quantiles.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize example data and params

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(100, 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
