#' # Perform uncertainty analysis

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' uncertainty <- uncertainty_bootstrap(data, "NOR", "L-moments")

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' # Evaluate model diagnostics

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- model_diagnostics(data, "NOR", params, uncertainty)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' # Generate a model assessment plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' plot_model_diagnostics(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
plot_model_diagnostics <- function(results, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(results$data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a dataframe for the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    2x
                    
                      
	x <- data[order(data, decreasing = TRUE)]   

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    2x
                    
                      
	df <- data.frame(x = x, y = x, estimates = results$estimates) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Get labels for the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	# Capture optional arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
	args <- list(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
    # Set default values

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
    title <- "Model Assessment"

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    2x
                    
                      
    xlabel <- expression(Model ~ Quantiles ~ m^3/s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
	ylabel <- expression(Observed ~ Quantiles ~ m^3/s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
    # Override defaults if provided

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$title))  title  <- args$title

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$xlabel)) xlabel <- args$xlabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    1x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(args$ylabel)) ylabel <- args$ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(data = df) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(x = x, y = .data$y),

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.1

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_point(

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(x = x, y = .data$estimates), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    2x
                    
                      
			color = "red",

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    2x
                    
                      
			size = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    2x
                    
                      
			alpha = 0.5

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    2x
                    
                      
		labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    2x
                    
                      
			title = title,

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    2x
                    
                      
			x = xlabel,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    2x
                    
                      
			y = ylabel

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Add theme and scales and return

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    2x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Parameter Estimation with L-Moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Estimate the parameters of one of nine different distributions (`GUM`, `NOR`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, `LP3`, and `WEI`) using the method of L-moments. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' First, the sample L-moments of the data are computed using the \link{lmom_sample} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' method. Then formulas from Hosking (1997) are used to compute the parameters from 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' the L-moments. Distributions `GNO`, `PE3`, and `LP3` use a rational approximation 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' to compute the parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of parameters:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - If `model` is `"GUM"`, `"NOR"`, or `"LNO"`, returns a vector of length 2.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - Otherwise, returns a vector of length 3.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J.R.M. & Wallis, J.R., 1997. Regional frequency analysis: an approach based 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' on L-Moments. Cambridge University Press, New York, USA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{fit_lmom_fast}, \link{fit_lmom_kappa}

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' fit_lmom_lp3(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @name fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_gum <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    5x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    5x
                    
                      
	fit_lmom_fast(data, "GUM")

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_nor <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    5x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    5x
                    
                      
	fit_lmom_fast(data, "NOR")

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_lno <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    5x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    5x
                    
                      
	fit_lmom_fast(data, "LNO")

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_gev <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    5x

                    56
                    5x
                    
                      
	fit_lmom_fast(data, "GEV")

}

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    60

                    61

                    67

                    68
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_gno <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69

                    74

                    75

                    5x

                    81
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_lp3 <- function(data) {

                    84
                    5x
                    
                      
	fit_lmom_fast(data, "LP3")

                    86

#' @rdname fit_lmom_methods

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
fit_lmom_wei <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    5x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    5x
                    
                      
	fit_lmom_fast(data, "WEI")

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the first four sample L-moments and L-moment ratios from a numeric 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' vector of data. L-moments are linear combinations of order statistics that 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' provide robust alternatives to conventional moments, with advantages in 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' parameter estimation for heavy-tailed and skewed distributions.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' Given probability weighted moments \eqn{\beta_0, \beta_1, \beta_2, \beta_3}, the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' first four sample L-moments are: 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_1 = \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_2 = 2\beta_1 - \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_3 = 6\beta_2 - 6\beta_1 + \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_4 = 20\beta_3 - 30\beta_2 + 12\beta_1 - \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' Then, the sample L-skewness is \eqn{t_3 = l_3 / l_2} and the sample L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' is \eqn{t_4 = l_4 / l_2}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector containing the first four L-moments and L-moment ratios:

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `l1`: L-mean

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `l2`: L-variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t3`: L-skewness

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t4`: L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @note This function has no parameter validation because \link{uncertainty_bootstrap} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' makes many calls to it. If you are getting errors, ensure that `data` is a positive, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' numeric vector.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' lmom_sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J. R. M. (1990). L-moments: Analysis and estimation of distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' using linear combinations of order statistics. *Journal of the Royal Statistical

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' Society: Series B (Methodological)*, 52(1), 105–124.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
lmom_sample <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Sort the data in increasing order

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    433219x
                    
                      
	x <- sort(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    433219x
                    
                      
	n <- length(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    433219x
                    
                      
	i <- 1:n

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# Recursively compute the probability weighted moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    433219x
                    
                      
	vb0 <- x / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    433219x
                    
                      
	vb1 <- vb0 * (i - 1) / (n - 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    433219x
                    
                      
	vb2 <- vb1 * (i - 2) / (n - 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    433219x
                    
                      
	vb3 <- vb2 * (i - 3) / (n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    433219x
                    
                      
	b0 <- sum(vb0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    433219x
                    
                      
	b1 <- sum(vb1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    433219x
                    
                      
	b2 <- sum(vb2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    433219x
                    
                      
	b3 <- sum(vb3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the first four sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    433219x
                    
                      
	l1 <- b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    433219x
                    
                      
	l2 <- (2 * b1) - b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    433219x
                    
                      
	l3 <- (6 * b2) - (6 * b1) + b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    433219x
                    
                      
	l4 <- (20 * b3) - (30 * b2) + (12 * b1) - b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results (l1, l2, t3, t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    433219x
                    
                      
	c(l1 ,l2, l3 / l2, l4 / l2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Generalized Log-Likelihood Functions for GEV Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the generalized log-likelihood for stationary and non-stationary 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' variants of the  Generalized Extreme Value (GEV) distribution with a Beta 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' prior on the shape parameter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' The generalized log-likelihood is defined as sum of the log-likelihood of the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' specified model and the log-density of the Beta prior with parameters \eqn{(p, q)}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' The contribution of the prior is: \deqn{\log \pi(\kappa) = (p-1) \log(0.5-\kappa) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' + (q-1) \log(0.5+\kappa) - \log (\beta(p, q))}

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-data

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-params

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-years

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams param-trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric scalar. The generalized log-likelihood value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{general_loglik_fast}

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize data, params, prior, years, and trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' prior <- c(5, 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' trend <- list(location = TRUE, scale = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the generalized log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' general_loglik_gev(data, params, prior, years, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
general_loglik_gev <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	params,

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	prior,

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	years = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	trend = NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    15x
                    
                      
	data <- validate_data(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    15x
                    
                      
	params <- validate_params(params, "GEV", trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    15x
                    
                      
	prior <- validate_prior(prior)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    15x
                    
                      
	years <- validate_years(years, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    15x
                    
                      
	trend <- validate_trend(trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    15x
                    
                      
	general_loglik_fast(data, "GEV", params, prior, years, trend)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
